<P class="p805 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">Pursuant to transactions carried out for the account of the Fund by the Beneficiary for the purpose of implementing the Fund's objectives with one or more counterparties (each a "</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Counterparty</SPAN>"), the Beneficiary will enter into guarantees, financing arrangements in the form of loans, facilities or other finance agreements, equity investments or other transactions (including the EIB/EIF Arrangement), such transactions being entered into in accordance with the terms and conditions (and in particular the governance and decision process) of the Fund (the "<SPAN class="ft97">Transactions</SPAN>").</P>
<P class="p806 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft167">As part of the Transactions, the Beneficiary has entered or will enter into a </SPAN><NOBR>back-to-back</NOBR> arrangement with the European Investment Fund ("<SPAN class="ft159">EIF</SPAN>") for the account of the Fund pursuant to which coverage will be provided to the EIF in relation to its role under the program for transactions relating to the Fund in accordance with the Fund Description and for the purpose of implementing the Fund's objectives (the "<SPAN class="ft159">EIB</SPAN>/<SPAN class="ft159">EIF Arrangement</SPAN>").</P>
<P class="p807 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">The Guarantors hereby grant an autonomous first demand guarantee (</SPAN><SPAN class="ft169">garantie autonome à première demande</SPAN>) in favour of the Beneficiary (the "<SPAN class="ft159">First Demand Guarantee</SPAN>") pursuant to this guarantee agreement (the "<SPAN class="ft159">Guarantee Agreement</SPAN>").</P>
<P class="p806 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">An initial group of EU Member States has each entered into a contribution agreement and such Member States will grant this Guarantee as Original Guarantors. Over time, other Member States intend to enter into a contribution agreement with the European Investment Bank in the context of the Fund and will accede to this Guarantee as Acceding Guarantors. European Union institutions or institutions created by Member States of the European Union will accede to this Guarantee if they contribute to the Fund.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p808 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">At any point in time, this Guarantee Agreement shall apply as an autonomous first demand guarantee obligation between the Guarantors then party to this Guarantee Agreement and the Beneficiary, in accordance with the terms hereof.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p806 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">The parties to this Guarantee Agreement expressly agree that any reference in this Guarantee Agreement to the Transactions, the Transaction Terms or any exposure thereunder shall under no circumstances be construed as affecting the independent, autonomous, unconditional and irrevocable nature of the First Demand Guarantee granted pursuant to this Guarantee Agreement.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p810 ft159">NOW THEREFORE it is hereby agreed as follows:</P>
<P class="p811 ft159">DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION</P>
<P class="p812 ft159">Interpretation</P>
<P class="p813 ft23">In this Guarantee Agreement, unless a contrary indication appears:</P>
<P class="p814 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">any reference to:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p815 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">the "Guarantors", the "Beneficiary" and the "Counterparty" shall be construed to include its and any subsequent successors in title, permitted assigns and permitted transferees;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p816 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft171">this "First Demand Guarantee", this "Guarantee Agreement" or any other agreement or instrument is a reference to such agreement or instrument as amended, novated, supplemented, extended or restated from time to time;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p817 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft172">a "person" includes any person, firm, company, corporation, government, state or agency of a state or any association, trust or partnership (whether having separate legal personality or not);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p818 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">a "regulation" includes any regulation, rule, official directive, request or guideline (whether or not having the force of law) of any governmental, intergovernmental or supranational body, agency, department or regulatory, </SPAN><NOBR>self-regulatory</NOBR> or other authority or organisation;</P>
<P class="p819 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">a reference to a legal provision is a reference to that provision as amended or re- enacted; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p820 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft174">save as otherwise provided, a time of day is a reference to Luxembourg time;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p821 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">references to Articles, Recitals and Schedules are, save if explicitly stipulated otherwise, references respectively to articles of, recitals and schedules to this Guarantee Agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p822 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">Articles and Schedules headings are for ease of reference only and shall not impact the interpretation of this Guarantee Agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p823 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">words importing the singular shall include the plural form and vice versa; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p821 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">a term used in any notice given under or in connection with this First Demand Guarantee or this Guarantee Agreement has the same meaning as ascribed to it in this Guarantee Agreement.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p814 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Accession Date</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Article 8.1(c).</P>
<P class="p813 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Accession Notice</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Article 8.1(b).</P>
<P class="p814 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Acceding Guarantor</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Article 8.1(a).</P>
<P class="p825 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Business Day</SPAN>" means any day other than a Saturday or a Sunday (a) where the Beneficiary is open for business in Luxembourg, and (b) where referring to a payment in EUR, a TARGET Settlement Day.</P>
<P class="p826 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Counterparty</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Recital (b) and shall include EIF in its capacity as counterparty of the Beneficiary under the EIB/EIF Arrangement.</P>
<P class="p823 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Demand</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Article 1.2.</P>
<P class="p814 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Demand Notice</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Article 1.2.</P>

"<SPAN class="ft175">EIB/EIF Arrangement" </SPAN>has the meaning ascribed to such term in Recital (c). "<SPAN class="ft175">EIF</SPAN>" means the European Investment Fund.</P>

<P class="p829 ft160">"<SPAN class="ft159">EUR</SPAN>" or "<SPAN class="ft159">euro</SPAN>" means the lawful currency of the Member States of the European Union which adopt or have adopted it as their currency in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Treaty on European Union and the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union or their succeeding treaties.</P>
<P class="p830 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Fund</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Recital (a).</P>
<P class="p831 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Guarantor</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in the description of the parties in the preamble, and shall include, as of each Accession Date, each Acceding Guarantor who has adhered to this Guarantee Agreement with effect on such Accession Date.</P>
<P class="p832 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Maximum Guarantee Amount</SPAN>" has the meaning ascribed to such term in Article 1.1.</P>
<P class="p831 ft160">"<SPAN class="ft159">Maximum Initial Individual Amount</SPAN>" means the maximum amount for which each Guarantor may be liable under this Guarantee and which is set out for each Guarantor in Schedule D, as such Schedule will be updated with the accession of Acceding Guarantors by notification to all Guarantors by the Beneficiary.</P>
<P class="p833 ft26">"<SPAN class="ft97">Maximum Individual Amount</SPAN>" means for each Guarantor, (i) initially, at the time of signing this Agreement as Original Guarantor or acceding thereto as Acceding Guarantor, the amount of the Maximum Initial Individual Amount and then (ii) from time to time, the amount under (i) as reduced (or increased, but never to an amount higher than the Maximum Initial Individual Amount) in accordance with the terms of this Guarantee Agreement.</P>
<P class="p834 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Original Guarantor</SPAN>" means a Guarantor that has entered into this Agreement on the date of this Agreement.</P>

<P class="p837 ft23">"<SPAN class="ft159">Tax</SPAN>" means any tax, levy, impost, duty or other charge or withholding of a similar nature (including any penalty or interest payable in connection with any failure to pay or any delay in paying any of the same).</P>

<P class="p839 ft177">ARTICLE 1</P>
<P class="p840 ft177">First Demand Guarantee</P>
<P class="p841 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">1.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">First Demand Guarantee</SPAN></P>
<P class="p842 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">The Guarantors hereby irrevocably and unconditionally undertake to pay to the Beneficiary, on the Beneficiary's first written demand, and in accordance with the conditions set out here below, all sums which the Beneficiary may claim hereunder up to a maximum amount constituted for each of them by its Maximum Individual Amount and collectively by the sum total of all Maximum Individual Amounts (together the "</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Maximum Guarantee Amount</SPAN>").</P>
<P class="p843 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">Subject to Article 0 and without prejudice to Article 8.2 hereunder, the Maximum Individual Amount for each Guarantor shall be reduced by the sums paid by it pursuant to and in accordance with this Article 1.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p845 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">1.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft179">Demands and payments</SPAN></P>
<P class="p846 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">Subject to Article 3, any demand made by the Beneficiary to the Guarantors under this Guarantee Agreement (each, a "</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Demand</SPAN>") shall be made by way of a written notification addressed by the Beneficiary to the Guarantors and their agent in the form set out in Schedule A (each a “<SPAN class="ft97">Demand Notice</SPAN>”), sent in accordance with the provisions set forth in Article 6 below, it being understood that:</P>
<P class="p847 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">the Beneficiary shall indicate in the Demand Notice (i) the Transaction with reference to which the Demand is made or (ii) that it relates to the EIB/EIF Arrangement, but shall otherwise be under no obligation to provide the Guarantors with any additional document nor to support its claim with any other justification or evidence;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p848 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">the payment obligation of the Guarantors under this Guarantee Agreement is not subject to the accuracy or the merit of any statement, declaration or information contained in any Demand Notice.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p849 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">The Beneficiary shall make a Demand under this Guarantee on all Guarantors for the total amount of such Demand, indicating the pro rata allocation of the amount between the Guarantors on the basis of their portion in the Maximum Guarantee Amount.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p849 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">The Guarantors shall make the payment requested in the Demand Notice within 5 (five) Business Days as from the date of dispatch (included) as set out in the Demand Notice (the "</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Payment Period</SPAN>") and in the currency as requested within the Demand Notice.</P>
<P class="p850 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">The Beneficiary is entitled to request the payment of any amount in one or several instalments.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p851 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">There shall be no limit on the number of Demands under this Guarantee.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p845 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">1.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft179">Independent payment obligation</SPAN></P>
<P class="p852 ft23">Each Guarantor expressly acknowledges that each Demand made in accordance with this Agreement generates an independent payment obligation toward the Beneficiary up to its Maximum Individual Amount.</P>
<P class="p853 ft177">ARTICLE 2</P>
<P class="p854 ft177">Autonomy of the First Demand Guarantee</P>
<P class="p855 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">2.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft179">Autonomy of the First Demand Guarantee</SPAN></P>
<P class="p856 ft26">The parties to this Guarantee Agreement expressly agree that this First Demand Guarantee is an independent, unconditional and irrevocable first demand guarantee (<SPAN class="ft19">garantie autonome à première demande</SPAN>), autonomous from any contractual or <NOBR>non-contractual</NOBR> relation existing or which may exist between the Guarantors, the Beneficiary, the Counterparty and any other person, which cannot be construed in any circumstances and for whatever reason as a surety (<SPAN class="ft19">cautionnement</SPAN>) within the meaning of article 2011 of the Luxembourg Civil Code or as any other accessory obligation or contract (<SPAN class="ft19">obligation ou contrat accessoire</SPAN>).</P>
<P class="p857 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">2.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft179">No defence</SPAN></P>
<P class="p858 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">Each Guarantor hereby expressly waives any right it has, or may have, which might reduce or extinguish its payment obligations under this Guarantee Agreement whether by way of </SPAN><NOBR>set-off,</NOBR> lien, defence or otherwise.</P>
<P class="p859 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">Each Guarantor acknowledges that it cannot raise any objection, ground or plea of any kind, in particular based on a Transaction or the Transaction Terms, to refuse or delay the performance of its obligations under this Guarantee Agreement and/or any payment to be made by it under this Guarantee Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p860 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">In particular, but without limitation, each Guarantor acknowledges that its obligations to make payments hereunder are independent from:</SPAN></P>

<P class="p862 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">the validity, regularity and/or enforceability of a Transaction and the rights and obligations of the Counterparty thereunder;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p863 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft171">any absence of action by the Beneficiary against a Counterparty to enforce the Beneficiary’s rights under a Transaction;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p864 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft172">any waiver or consent given by the Beneficiary with respect to any provisions governing a Transaction;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p865 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">the occurrence of any event whatsoever which could prevent a Counterparty from performing any of its obligations, including its payment obligations, under a Transaction, including in relation to the opening of any voluntary or judicial insolvency proceedings in any jurisdiction or any payment moratorium or similar measure or measure of similar effect applicable to a Counterparty under any applicable law;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p866 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">the existence or absence of payments under Demands made to or payments thereunder by other Guarantors under the present Guarantee Agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p864 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft174">any other circumstances which might otherwise constitute a legal discharge of or a defence for the Guarantors.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p867 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">Therefore, no Guarantor shall, in particular but without limitation, be entitled to challenge any demand of payment under this Guarantee Agreement nor raise any objection, defence, exception, deduction, withholding, lien, right of </SPAN><NOBR>set-off</NOBR> or counterclaim resulting from or related to:</P>
<P class="p868 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">any provisions governing a Transaction;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p869 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft171">any relationship between the Beneficiary and a Counterparty, the Guarantor and a Counterparty, or the Guarantor and the Beneficiary;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p870 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft180">any change in the legal and/or financial situation of a Counterparty (including any merger, demerger or other form of legal or corporate reorganisation);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p871 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft174">any negligence or omission by the Beneficiary, except in case of wilful misconduct or gross negligence;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p864 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">any payment moratorium or similar measure or measure of similar effect applicable to a Counterparty under any applicable law; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p872 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">any arrangement or agreement between the Beneficiary and a Counterparty including any grant of time, indulgence, waiver or concession, cure period or delay or forbearance, or any termination, amendment, variation, novation, replacement or supplement (including any change in the purpose of, or any increase in, or extension of, Transaction Terms) which may be granted to a Counterparty under a Transaction.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p873 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">2.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Other rights</SPAN></P>
<P class="p874 ft26">The First Demand Guarantee granted pursuant to this Guarantee Agreement is in addition to any other rights, remedies or security, which the Beneficiary has, or may have, against any other person, including against a Counterparty, whether provided for by law or otherwise.</P>
<P class="p833 ft26">Each Guarantor hereby expressly accepts and acknowledges that the Beneficiary will not be required to proceed against or enforce any other rights, security or claim payment from any other person before making a claim under this Guarantee Agreement.</P>

<P class="p876 ft177">ARTICLE 3</P>
<P class="p877 ft177">Term of the First Demand Guarantee</P>
<P class="p855 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">3.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft179">Effectiveness Period</SPAN></P>
<P class="p878 ft23">This First Demand Guarantee shall take effect on the date of execution of this Guarantee Agreement and expire on the earlier of (the "<SPAN class="ft159">Termination Date</SPAN>"):</P>
<P class="p879 ft26"><SPAN class="ft23">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">the date on which the aggregate of all payments irrevocably made by the Guarantors under this Guarantee Agreement amounts to the Maximum Guarantee Amount; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p850 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">31 December 2037 subject to any extension agreed in writing by the Beneficiary and the Guarantors.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p880 ft23">Without prejudice to Article 0 below, the Beneficiary may issue a Demand under this Guarantee Agreement at any time as from the date of execution of this Guarantee Agreement up to a date falling 3 (three) calendar months after the occurrence of the Termination Date (the "<SPAN class="ft159">Effectiveness Period</SPAN>").</P>
<P class="p881 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">3.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft179">Reinstatement</SPAN></P>
<P class="p882 ft160">Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Guarantee Agreement, if any payment made by a Guarantor to the Beneficiary or any discharge given by the Beneficiary is avoided or reduced as a result of any insolvency or any similar event, the liability of the Guarantor shall continue or be reinstated (as the case may be) as if the payment, discharge, avoidance or reduction, had not occurred; and the Beneficiary shall be entitled to recover the value or amount of that security or payment from the Guarantor as if the payment, discharge, avoidance or reduction had not occurred.</P>
<P class="p883 ft177">ARTICLE 4</P>
<P class="p778 ft177">Default Interest</P>
<P class="p855 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">4.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft179">Default interest</SPAN></P>
<P class="p856 ft26">If any amount under this Agreement is not paid on the date it is due then such unpaid amount shall bear interest at the rate of €STR plus a spread of two per cent (2%) floored at zero calculated on a daily basis which interest shall accrue from the date when payment was due until the date of actual payment of such unpaid amount. For this purpose €STR means the euro <NOBR>short-term</NOBR> rate administered by the European Central Bank (or any other person which takes over the administration of that rate) displayed (before any correction, recalculation or republication by the administrator) on page EUROSTR of the Thomson Reuters screen (or any replacement Thomson Reuters page which displays that rate).</P>
<P class="p884 ft177">ARTICLE 5</P>
<P class="p885 ft177">Currency</P>
<P class="p886 ft23">Any payment to be made by the Guarantors under this Guarantee Agreement shall be made in EUR.</P>

<P class="p892 ft177">ARTICLE 7</P>
<P class="p893 ft177">Transfer and Continuing Obligations</P>
<P class="p841 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">7.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Transfer</SPAN></P>
<P class="p829 ft23">Rights and/or obligations of the Guarantors under this Guarantee Agreement cannot be transferred or assigned in any way whatsoever to any third parties without the prior written consent of the Beneficiary.</P>
<P class="p894 ft177">ARTICLE 8</P>
<P class="p895 ft177">Accession</P>
<P class="p841 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">8.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Accession Process</SPAN></P>
<P class="p896 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">A Member State of the European Union, a European Union institution, or an institution created by Member States of the European Union, which is not an Original Guarantor shall accede to this Guarantee Agreement as Acceding Guarantor (an "</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Acceding Guarantor</SPAN>") at the time of execution of its Contribution Agreement in the context of the Fund.</P>
<P class="p808 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">For the purpose of acceding to this Guarantee Agreement, each Acceding Guarantor shall give an accession notice by way of a written notification addressed by it or its agents to the Beneficiary and to all then existing Guarantors in the form set out in Schedule B (each an “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Accession Notice</SPAN>”), sent in accordance with the provisions set forth in Article 6 above.</P>
<P class="p897 ft26"><SPAN class="ft23">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft181">The accession by the Acceding Guarantor to the present Guarantee Agreement shall be effective on the date set out in the Accession Notice (the "</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Accession Date</SPAN>").</P>
<P class="p898 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">The Beneficiary and the then existing Guarantors authorise, acknowledge and agree in advance to the accession from time to time of an Acceding Guarantor to the present Guarantee Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p899 ft177"><SPAN class="ft97">8.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Accession</SPAN></P>
<P class="p829 ft23">From the Accession Date, the Acceding Guarantor will adhere to, and be bound in all respects by, this Guarantee Agreement and will accordingly be entitled to all rights and subject to all obligations imposed on the Guarantors hereunder.</P>
<P class="p900 ft26">If at the time of entering into the Contribution Agreement the Acceding Guarantor indemnifies any other Guarantors in relation to payments made in respect of any prior Demands under this Guarantee Agreement in accordance with the provisions of the Contribution Agreement, the Maximum Individual Amount of the Acceding Guarantor shall be reduced by any amount thus</P>

<P class="p903 ft177">ARTICLE 9</P>
<P class="p904 ft177">Severability</P>
<P class="p905 ft23">If at any time any provision of this Guarantee Agreement is or becomes illegal, invalid or unenforceable in any respect, or this Guarantee Agreement is or becomes ineffective in any respect, under the laws of any jurisdiction, such illegality, invalidity, unenforceability or ineffectiveness shall not affect:</P>
<P class="p906 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">the legality, validity or enforceability in that jurisdiction of any other provision of this Guarantee Agreement or the effectiveness in any other respect of this First Demand Guarantee in that jurisdiction; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p907 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">the legality, validity or enforceability in other jurisdictions of that or any other provision of this Guarantee Agreement or the effectiveness of this First Demand Guarantee under the laws of such other jurisdictions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p908 ft177">ARTICLE 10</P>
<P class="p909 ft177">No Waiver</P>
<P class="p905 ft23">No failure or delay or single or partial exercise by the Beneficiary in exercising any of its rights or remedies under this Guarantee Agreement shall be construed as a waiver of such right or remedy and the Beneficiary shall not be liable for any such failure, delay or single or partial exercise of any such right and remedy.</P>
<P class="p910 ft177">ARTICLE 11</P>
<P class="p911 ft177"><NOBR>Set-Off</NOBR></P>
<P class="p912 ft26">The Beneficiary may set off any matured obligation due from a Guarantor under this Guarantee Agreement against any matured obligation (whether or not matured) owed by the Beneficiary to that Guarantor, regardless of the place of payment, booking branch or currency of either obligation. If either obligation is unliquidated or unascertained, the Beneficiary may set off in an amount estimated by it in good faith to be the amount of that obligation.</P>
<P class="p913 ft177">ARTICLE 12</P>
<P class="p914 ft177">Amendments</P>
<P class="p915 ft23">Any provision of this Guarantee Agreement may only be amended with the prior written consent of the Beneficiary and the Guarantors.</P>
<P class="p913 ft177">ARTICLE 13</P>
<P class="p916 ft177">Waiver of Sovereign Immunity</P>
<P class="p912 ft26">To the extent that a Guarantor may in any jurisdiction claim for itself or its assets or revenues immunity from suit, execution, attachment (whether in aid of execution, before judgement or otherwise) or other legal process and to the extent that such immunity (whether or not claimed) may be attributed in any such jurisdiction to such Guarantor or its assets or revenues, such</P>

<P class="p995 ft23">in respect of the</P>
<P class="p996 ft159"><NOBR>PAN-EUROPEAN</NOBR> GUARANTEE FUND IN RESPONSE TO <NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR></P>

<P class="p998 ft23">This contribution agreement (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Contribution Agreement</SPAN>”) is entered into between:</P>
<P class="p999 ft159"><SPAN class="ft23">the </SPAN>Kingdom of Sweden<SPAN class="ft23">,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p734 ft159"><SPAN class="ft23">(the “</SPAN>Contributor<SPAN class="ft23">”),</SPAN></P>
<P class="p735 ft23">on the one hand, and</P>
<P class="p1000 ft159"><SPAN class="ft23">the </SPAN>European Investment Bank<SPAN class="ft23">,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1001 ft176">with its seat at <NOBR>98-100,</NOBR> boulevard Konrad Adenauer, <NOBR>L-2950</NOBR> Luxembourg, Grand Duchy of Luxembourg, (the “<SPAN class="ft175">Bank</SPAN>”),</P>
<P class="p1002 ft23">on the other hand,</P>
<P class="p734 ft23">(the Contributor and the Bank each referred to as a “<SPAN class="ft159">Party</SPAN>” and together as the “<SPAN class="ft159">Parties</SPAN>”).</P>
<P class="p1003 ft23">Whereas:</P>
<P class="p1004 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">The Member States of the European Union have agreed to establish the EU </SPAN><NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> Guarantee Fund (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Fund</SPAN>”).</P>
<P class="p1005 ft26"><SPAN class="ft23">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft195">Each contributor to the Fund shall enter into an undertaking to make contributions to the Fund on similar terms and conditions through their respective contribution agreements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p765 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">Each contributor to the Fund has entered into (or will accede to) the first demand guarantee agreement (the “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Guarantee Agreement</SPAN>”) with the Bank in relation to Transactions entered into by the Bank for the account of the Fund (including the <NOBR>back-to-back</NOBR> arrangement with the European Investment Fund ("<SPAN class="ft159">EIF</SPAN>")).</P>
<P class="p1006 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">The Bank shall enter into a separate arrangement with the EIF in connection with Transactions entered into by EIF in the context of the Fund.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1007 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft196">The intention of the Parties is that in relation to all exposures to Transactions of EIB for the account of the Fund and/or EIF in the context of the Fund and the EIB/EIF Arrangement, all credit, market and other risks are assumed by and will be ultimately borne by the Fund and by the contributors and not by the Bank or the EIF. Consistently, the Bank will act in relation to Transactions for the account of the Fund. The Bank shall provide a dedicated internal funding line to the Bank as administrator of the Fund for the purposes of providing liquidity to and treasury for the Fund.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1008 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">Any Transaction to be entered into by EIB and/or EIF in the context of the EIB/EIF Arrangement is subject to the approval of the Fund’s Contributors’ Committee as further described in the Fund Description.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1009 ft23">The Parties have agreed as follows:</P>
<P class="p734 ft177"><SPAN class="ft98">I.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft198">Definitions</SPAN></P>
<P class="p777 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">In this Contribution Agreement:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1010 ft201">“<SPAN class="ft200">Advance</SPAN>” means as defined in Annex 2, paragraph III A. "<SPAN class="ft200">Acceding Guarantor</SPAN>" means as defined in paragraph 17.</P>
<P class="p1011 ft23">2</P>

<P class="p1012 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Additional Contributor</SPAN>” means as defined in paragraph 17.</P>
<P class="p1013 ft160">“<SPAN class="ft159">Adjusted Key Percentage</SPAN>” means the percentage set out against the name of each contributor to the Fund calculated by reference to the Total Contributions and the shareholding of each contributor in the capital of the Bank but adjusted such that at all times, the aggregate of Adjusted Key Percentages is equal to 100%. In the event of an Additional Contributor, the Adjusted Key Percentage shall be <NOBR>re-calculated</NOBR> accordingly and communicated to the contributors.</P>
<P class="p1014 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Adjustment Payments</SPAN>” means as defined in paragraph 17.</P>
<P class="p758 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Business Day</SPAN>” means any day other than a Saturday or Sunday (a) where the Bank is open for business in Luxembourg and (b) where referring to a payment in euro or the determination of EURIBOR, is also a TARGET2 Business Day.</P>
<P class="p1013 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Cash Balance</SPAN>” means any sums held in cash by the Bank on behalf of the contributors in relation to the Fund.</P>
<P class="p1015 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Claim Event</SPAN>” means, in relation to a Transaction, one or more of the following events or occurrences (as applicable):</P>
<P class="p1016 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft202">in relation to a Transaction which is a funded debt transaction that the Bank has not received any amount paid by it and/or due to it (whether principal, interest, commissions, fees, charges, indemnities, expenses or any other incidental charges in respect of such Transaction);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1017 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">in relation to a Transaction which is a funded risk participation or a contingent loan transaction (i) that the Bank has not received any amount due to it or (ii) that the Bank has not received any amount scheduled or planned or expected to be paid to it, where such non payment to the Bank resulted from the limited recourse nature of such Transaction or for other reasons intrinsic to the nature of such Transaction (in each case whether such amounts relate to principal, interest, commissions, fees, charges, indemnities, expenses or any other incidental charges in respect of such Transaction);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1018 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft204">in relation to a Transaction which is an unfunded transaction relating to an underlying debt transaction, (i) that the Bank has not received any amount due to it or (ii) that the Bank has received a demand for payment (in each case whether the amounts due or demanded or paid relate to principal, interest, commissions, fees, charges, indemnities, expenses or any other incidental charges in respect of such Transaction);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1016 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">(d) that a Transaction has been subject to a restructuring or similar process which reduces any of the amounts payable to the Bank in relation to such Transaction (whether principal, interest, commissions, fees, charges, indemnities, expenses or any other incidental charges in respect of such Transaction);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1019 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">in relation to a Transaction which is an equity type operation that upon exit or disposal the net proceeds received by the Bank is less than the sum of (i) the amount invested or lent by the Bank and (ii) the Bank's cost of funding such Transaction;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1020 ft26"><SPAN class="ft164">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft206">in relation to a Transaction which has not fully matured, repaid in full or been disposed of by 31 December 2037, that the aggregate amount received or recovered by the Bank in respect of such Transaction is less than the sum of (i) the amount invested or lent by the Bank and (ii) the Bank's cost of funding such Transaction;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1021 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft202">in relation to operations deployed by EIF in the context of the Fund under the EIB/EIF Arrangement that (i) there has been a claim event in relation to such operation as defined for the purpose of the EIB/EIF Arrangement or (ii) as at 31 December 2037 the Bank has not been repaid in full in relation to any liquidity advance and any interest accrued thereon under the EIB/EIF Arrangement; or</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1024 ft23">If no Claim Event is designated in relation to a Transaction, then the Claim Event or Claim Events that correspond most closely to the legal nature and financial and other characteristics of such Transaction shall be deemed to have been so designated.</P>

<P class="p767 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">EIB/EIF Arrangement</SPAN>” means the agreements or arrangements entered into between the Bank and EIF in relation to operations deployed by the EIF in the context of the Fund as described in Recital (D).</P>

<P class="p1027 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">EURIBOR” </SPAN>means as defined in Annex 2 paragraph IV B.</P>

<P class="p1027 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Fund” </SPAN>means as defined in Recital (A).</P>
<P class="p1027 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Fund Description</SPAN>” means as defined in paragraph 5.</P>
<P class="p1029 ft201">“<SPAN class="ft200">Guarantee Agreement</SPAN>” means as defined in Recital (C). “<SPAN class="ft200">Liquidity Facility” </SPAN>means as defined in paragraph 12.</P>
<P class="p1030 ft209">“<SPAN class="ft208">Original Guarantor</SPAN>” means as defined in Definitions section of the Guarantee Agreement. “<SPAN class="ft208">Payment Dates</SPAN>” means as defined in paragraph 9.</P>
<P class="p1026 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Platform Rules</SPAN>” means as defined in paragraph 5.</P>
<P class="p1027 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Required Proportion</SPAN>” means the then applicable Adjusted Key Percentage.</P>
<P class="p1031 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">TARGET2 Business Day</SPAN>” means a day on which the <NOBR>Trans-European</NOBR> Automated <NOBR>Real-time</NOBR> Gross Settlement Express Transfer payment system which utilises a single shared platform and which was launched on 19 November 2007 (TARGET2) is open for the settlement of payments in EUR.</P>
<P class="p1032 ft26">“<SPAN class="ft97">Transaction</SPAN>” means an operation entered into by the Bank for the account of the Fund which is eligible in accordance with the Platform Rules and the Fund Description, including the EIB/EIF Arrangement (and which has a designated or a deemed designated Claim Event).</P>
<P class="p768 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Total Contributions</SPAN>” means as defined in paragraph 3.</P>

<P class="p726 ft177"><SPAN class="ft98">II.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft210">The Contribution</SPAN></P>
<P class="p727 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft211">The Contributor wishes to make a commitment, and the Bank (as administrator of the Fund) hereby accepts such commitment, to the Fund in the amount of EUR 863,337,361.61 (</SPAN><SPAN class="ft19">eight</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1034 ft19">hundred <NOBR>sixty-three</NOBR> million three hundred <NOBR>thirty-seven</NOBR> thousand three hundred <NOBR>sixty-one</NOBR> euro and <NOBR>sixty-one</NOBR> cents<SPAN class="ft26">) (the “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Contribution</SPAN><SPAN class="ft26">”), of which a part may be paid as an Upfront Payment.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p760 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">It is expected that the Fund will receive additional contributions, under similar terms and conditions (together with the Contribution, the “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Total Contributions</SPAN>”).</P>
<P class="p1035 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft211">In the context of the Fund, Contributions, and the Total Contribution shall be used to fund payments to be made by contributors under the Guarantee Agreement and this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p761 ft160"><SPAN class="ft26">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft212">Capitalised terms used in this Contribution Agreement and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meaning given to such terms in the Fund Description (the “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Fund Description</SPAN>”) included as Annex 1(A), Partnership Platform Rules (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Platform Rules</SPAN>”) included as Annex 1(B). The Fund is documented on the terms of the contribution agreements, the Fund Description, and the Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1036 ft213"><SPAN class="ft213">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft214">The Contribution shall be used to meet Demands made under the Guarantee Agreement and any payments due under this Agreement and shall be allocated, administered, and managed by the Bank in accordance with (i) the Bank’s rules, policies, and procedures (save where adjustments to these rules, policies and procedures are applied in the context of the Fund and as further set out in the Fund Description), (ii) this Contribution Agreement, including the Fund Description, and (iii) the Guarantee Agreement. The Parties acknowledge and agree that in relation to operations covered by the EIB/EIF Arrangement, the rules, policies, and procedures of EIF shall apply (save where adjustments to these rules, policies and procedures are applied in the context of the Fund and as further set out in the Fund Description).</SPAN></P>

<P class="p754 ft23">9.</P>
<P class="p1041 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">The Bank shall open a register (the “Dedicated Register”) in respect of the Contributor, and in respect of all other contributors to the Fund, to credit and debit as appropriate (without double counting):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1042 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">the amount of the Upfront Payment and any additional cash contribution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft171">payments in respect of Demands;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft174">utilisation(s) of the relevant Contributor’s Liquidity Facility and/or its Cash Balance;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft23"><SPAN class="ft164">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft174">any interest accrued from the holding of or investment of the Cash Balance;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1044 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft168">any sums to be debited or credited in relation to Adjustment Payments between the contributors to the Fund ;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1045 ft160"><SPAN class="ft164">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">any amounts payable by the Contributor or due to the Contributor in accordance with the allocation rules and orders of priority of the Fund as set out in the Fund Description, unless otherwise claimed under the indemnity set out in paragraph 10 below;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1044 ft23"><SPAN class="ft164">(vii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft219">any amounts payable by the Contributor to the Bank as set out in paragraph 10 below; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1046 ft23"><SPAN class="ft164">(viii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">any other sums as appropriate.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1047 ft213"><SPAN class="ft213">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft221">On each payment date, each Contributor shall pay the outstanding amount due as reflected on its Dedicated Register. The Bank shall issue a request for payment 15 (fifteen) Business Days before each Payment Date. The first payment day shall take place on 15 December 2020 (the “First Payment Date”). After the First Payment Date, payments will occur on a quarterly basis on 15 June, 15 September, 15 December, and 15 March of each year (the First Payment Date, together with the following payment dates, the “Payment Dates”). For the avoidance of doubt, the required payments on a Payment Date in respect of the Dedicated Register do not include any Advances under the Liquidity Facility that have an Advance Repayment Date which is the Payment Date immediately subsequent to such Payment Date.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1048 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft222">If a Payment Date is scheduled to occur on a date which is not a Business Day then it shall be postponed to the next following Business Day unless such day would fall into the next calendar month in which case the Payment Date shall occur on the Business Day preceding the scheduled Payment Date.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1051 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft223">The Contributor shall upon first demand indemnify and hold harmless the Bank if (i) the Bank incurs funding costs in relation to the Fund, the Guarantee Agreement, this Agreement, the Liquidity Facility, or the EIB/EIF Arrangement, and/or (ii) the Bank is not paid interest or other amount under the Liquidity Facility which in each case have not been paid or reimbursed in accordance with the allocation rules and orders of priority of the Fund, as set out in the Fund Description.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1052 ft213"><SPAN class="ft213">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft224">The Contributor shall upon first demand indemnify and hold harmless the Bank if (i) the Bank suffers a capital loss or negative interest on any amount of cash between the date such sum is paid to the Bank by way of an Upfront Payment, a cash contribution, or an Advance and the date on which such sums are applied to discharge a liability to the Bank under this Agreement or under the Guarantee Agreement in respect of a Demand (ii) the Bank incurs or suffers foreign exchange losses in the context of the Fund (including in connection with the EIB/EIF Arrangement) and/or (iii) the Bank incurs or suffers any other form of loss, damage, expenses, claim or liability in the context of the Fund (including in connection with the EIB/EIF Arrangement) which is not otherwise recoverable from the Contributor and in each case such amounts are not reimbursed in accordance with the allocation rules and orders of priority of the Fund as set out in the Fund Description.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1053 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Unless otherwise stated by the Bank when making a demand for an indemnity payment under this paragraph 10, the Contributor shall make indemnity payments under this paragraph 10 through direct payment to the Bank upon first demand, within 15 Business Days from the Bank’s written request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1054 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft223">The liability of the Contributor to make payments under this paragraph 10 is limited by the amount of its Contribution. <P class="p722 ft159">VI. <SPAN class="ft177">Administration</SPAN></P>
<P class="p729 ft160"><SPAN class="ft26">11.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft196">The Bank shall manage the payment of Demands under the Guarantee Agreements, the crediting of Upfront Payments and other cash contributions (if any) to each contributor’s Dedicated Register, the debiting of each contributor’s Dedicated Register to meet its liabilities under this Agreement and the Guarantee Agreement, the payment of Demands by utilising the relevant contributor's Liquidity Facility, and the Adjustment Payments between the contributors when an Additional Contributor adheres to the Fund and Acceding Guarantor accedes to the Guarantee Agreement.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1058 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">15.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">It is acknowledged and agreed that the Bank, as agent of the Contributor, shall be entitled to make payments under this Agreement without reference to any other party and without any investigation or enquiry.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1059 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">16.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft195">Any recoveries relating to a Transaction shall be allocated and applied in accordance with the rules of allocation and orders of priority of the Fund as set out in the Fund Description.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1060 ft228"><SPAN class="ft213">17.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft226">If there is a change in the Adjusted Key Percentage due to the adherence of a new contributor (an “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft227">Additional Contributor</SPAN>” and an “<SPAN class="ft227">Acceding Guarantor</SPAN>”), the Bank shall make adjustments to the Dedicated Register of the Additional Contributor and the then existing contributors (“<SPAN class="ft227">Adjustment Payments</SPAN>”) such that all Demands and all indemnity payments under this Agreement including all those incurred and paid from the creation of the Fund shall ultimately be borne by each contributor in accordance with its Required Proportion as derived from the latest applicable Adjusted Key Percentage. The Adjustment Payments shall be reflected by debit and credit entries in the corresponding Dedicated Registers. The Bank, as agent of all Contributors, shall calculate the amount of all such Adjustment Payments between Contributors.</P>
<P class="p1061 ft160"><SPAN class="ft26">18.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft196">Each Contributor shall be a third party beneficiary of the obligations in respect of the obligation to make Adjustment Payments of each other contributor to the Fund under their respective contribution agreements but acknowledge and agree that any Adjustment Payments shall be made by the Bank acting as agent of all contributors to the Fund. <P class="p735 ft159">IX. <SPAN class="ft177">Reporting</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1062 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">19.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">The Bank shall prepare annual financial statements for the Fund. The financial statements shall be drawn up on the basis of cash receipts and disbursements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p741 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">20.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">The financial statements shall comprise a combined statement of account movements of the Fund, individual statements of account movements for each contributor, and additional disclosures notes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1063 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">21.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">The financial year of the Fund shall be the calendar year, except for the first financial period which shall begin at the time when first contribution agreements come into effect and end on 31 December 2020.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1064 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">22.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">All amounts shall be reported in Euro. Amounts denominated in a currency other than Euro shall be reported in Euro according to the Bank’s policies and procedures.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">23.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">The financial statements shall be subject to external audit and the costs of such audit shall be part of the fees charged by the Bank as set out in the Fund Description.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1095 ft236">Annex 1A</P>
<P class="p1096 ft237">Fund Description</P>
<P class="p1097 ft23">This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of all Contribution Agreements for the Pan European Guarantee Fund in response to <NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> (the “Fund”) between EIB and the Contributors to the Fund. It is made pursuant to the Rules of establishment and administration of the PPF (“Platform Rules”), as amended from time to time.</P>
<P class="p1098 ft159">1. Objectives</P>
<P class="p1099 ft23">The <NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> pandemic constitutes an unprecedented challenge with very severe <NOBR>socio-economic</NOBR> consequences.</P>
<P class="p1100 ft23">The objective of the Fund is to respond to the economic impact of the <NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> pandemic outbreak by ensuring that eligible entities and primarily SMEs in the participating Member States have sufficient liquidity available and access to finance to weather the rapidly unfolding crisis, and are able to continue their development in mid/long term.</P>
<P class="p1101 ft23">The Fund is designed to support final recipients that are considered (i) viable in the long term and (ii) able to meet a lender’s or other financial intermediaries’ requirements for commercial financing, were it not for the economic impact of the <NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> pandemic.</P>
<P class="p1102 ft23">The Fund is designed to be a <NOBR>high-risk,</NOBR> <NOBR>high-impact</NOBR> intervention of limited time.</P>
<P class="p1103 ft159">2. Eligible Contributors</P>
<P class="p1104 ft23">In accordance with Article 3.1 of the Platform Rules, any Member State of the European Union and the European Commission can make Contributions to the Fund.</P>
<P class="p1105 ft23">In addition, other institutions of the European Union or institutions created by Member States of the European Union, can make also Contributions to the Fund.</P>
<P class="p1106 ft159">3. Eligible operations</P>
<P class="p1104 ft23">Operations shall be eligible for support under the Fund if they are in line with the eligibility criteria, as set out below and updated from time to time (“Eligible Operations”).</P>
<P class="p1107 ft238">General:</P>
<P class="p1099 ft23">The Fund shall operate, to the extent applicable, in accordance with EIB’s and EIF’s respective rules, policies, and procedures, save where otherwise provided in 12 below. In the case of EIB, the impact finance mandate framework, as further described in 12, below shall apply.</P>
<P class="p1108 ft23">For EIB’s operations, the Fund shall be used according to the general <NOBR>cross-cutting</NOBR> principles applicable to the EIB’s activities, as described in Article 2.1.2 of the Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1107 ft238">Types of operations:</P>
<P class="p1109 ft26">EIB, for the account of the Fund and EIF, in the context of the Fund, can guarantee or provide financing directly to final recipients (“<SPAN class="ft97">Direct Operations</SPAN>” <SPAN class="ft239">1</SPAN>). Alternatively, EIB or EIF can guarantee or provide</P>
<P class="p1110 ft23">financing indirectly through financial intermediaries (“<SPAN class="ft159">Indirect Operations</SPAN>”<SPAN class="ft240">2</SPAN>) to eligible final</P>
<P class="p1111 ft26">beneficiaries – predominantly SMEs, but also Midcaps, Corporates and public entities providing essential services in particular in health, research, education sectors that could not be financed under existing EIB Group products. Direct Operations concern direct financing/ guarantees by EIB to eligible</P>
<P class="p1112 ft26"><SPAN class="ft241">1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft242">Direct Operation is defined as a final recipient transaction entered into between EIB and final recipient.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1113 ft26"><SPAN class="ft241">2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft243">Indirect Operation is an operation carried out by EIB or EIF to provide finance to a Financial Intermediary covering directly or indirectly (via one or more </SPAN><NOBR>sub-operations)</NOBR> a final recipient transaction.</P>

<P class="p1115 ft23">projects carried out by, among others, SMEs, Midcaps, Corporates and public entities. For Indirect Operations, EIB or EIF conclude agreements with financial intermediaries.</P>
<P class="p1116 ft160">Financial intermediaries (“<SPAN class="ft159">Financial Intermediaries</SPAN>” or “<SPAN class="ft159">FI</SPAN>”) may include counterparts such as commercial banks, financial institutions, guarantee institutions, leasing companies, venture capital and private equity funds, <NOBR>micro-finance</NOBR> institutions, National Promotional Banks/ Institutions, Special Purpose Vehicles (SPV), private credit funds, alternative lenders, <NOBR>crowd-lenders,</NOBR> guarantee societies etc.</P>
<P class="p1117 ft238">Eligible Beneficiaries</P>
<P class="p1118 ft23">Eligible Operations will be primarily private sector intermediated operations, but can also include direct and intermediated operations targeted at public sector companies and entities in the area of health or <NOBR>health-research</NOBR> or providing essential services related to the health crisis.</P>
<P class="p1119 ft23">At the end of the investment period, beneficiaries of funding or guarantee from the Fund (“Eligible Beneficiaries”) shall amount to:</P>
<P class="p1120 ft247"><SPAN class="ft26">a.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft245">Debt operations with SMEs as the final beneficiary will account for at least 65% of EGF- supported financing</SPAN><SPAN class="ft246">. This can also be supported through securitization.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1121 ft159"><SPAN class="ft26">b.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft248">Debt operations with </SPAN><NOBR>non-SMEs</NOBR> as the final beneficiary will account for a maximum of 28% of <NOBR>EGF-supported</NOBR> financing<SPAN class="ft23">. Out of this, a maximum of 5 p.p. of </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft23">EGF-supported</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft23"> financing can be used for debt operations with public sector companies and entities active in the area of health or </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft23">health-research</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft23"> or providing essential services related to the health crisis as final beneficiaries.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1122 ft162"><SPAN class="ft23">c.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft249">Venture and growth capital (through the EIF) and venture debt with SMEs and </SPAN><NOBR>mid-caps</NOBR> as final beneficiaries will account for a maximum of 7% of <NOBR>EGF-supported</NOBR> financing.</P>
<P class="p1123 ft159">Specifically for operations supporting large corporates <SPAN class="ft23">with more than 3000 employees as final beneficiaries, the following safeguards will apply:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1124 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft250">No equity</SPAN> investments</P>
<P class="p1125 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft251">No ABS</SPAN> operations</P>
<P class="p1125 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">Support available only for </SPAN><SPAN class="ft238">working capital</SPAN> and <SPAN class="ft238">supply chain finance</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1125 ft23"><SPAN class="ft164">iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">Financing </SPAN><SPAN class="ft238">only available through Financial Intermediaries</SPAN> with ‘skin in the game’</P>
<P class="p1125 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft251">Exposure to individual large corporates</SPAN> limited to EUR 250m</P>
<P class="p1126 ft23"><SPAN class="ft164">vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">Only loans </SPAN><SPAN class="ft238">in alignment with Communication from the European Commission regarding the temporary framework for State Aid measures to support the economy in the Covid- 19 outbreak, as amended or replaced from time to time</SPAN>, including regarding short loan <SPAN class="ft238">maturities,</SPAN> in order to rule out strategic investment projects that could be interpreted as ‘industrial policy’.</P>
<P class="p1127 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">vii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">Only for </SPAN><SPAN class="ft238">sectors that are in line with EIB </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft238">long-term</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft238"> mission</SPAN> (innovation, environment, and SMEs support).</P>
<P class="p1128 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">viii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft230">Further involve the Member States represented in the Contributors Committee on individual transactions, complemented with higher reporting requirements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1129 ft26">Without prejudice to 12.4 below, all operations shall undergo an <NOBR>ex-ante</NOBR> due diligence or equivalent process performed in accordance with EIB’s and EIF’s rules, policies and procedures, as applicable.</P>
<P class="p1130 ft238">Geographical Eligibility:</P>
<P class="p1131 ft26">Operations with FI (and final recipients) may be carried out in participating Member States, that is, Member States that have entered into Contribution Agreements with the EIB in relation to the Fund. The contributions of any given Member State will be available for operations in all participating Member States, i.e. contributions will not be earmarked to support the operations in a given Member State.</P>

<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1133 ft23">Instead, deployment will be determined based on the need and demand relative to the impact of COVID- 19 and the related market situation.</P>
<P class="p1134 ft26">EIB Group will make available additional financing in the context of the Fund in all contributing Member States, aiming for a geographic distribution that is proportionate to the economic impact of the crisis, the sizes of the economies and available national and European support instruments.</P>
<P class="p1135 ft23">By the end of the EGF signature period, EIB Group will aim that its financing<SPAN class="ft253">3</SPAN>:</P>
<P class="p1136 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">for the three Member States having received the most financing understood as the support by the Fund, the cumulative financing (measured by signature amounts) does not exceed 50% share of the total Fund’s financing</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1137 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft233">for the 15 Member States having received the least financing understood as the support by the Fund, the cumulative financing (measured by signature amounts) exceeds 10% share of the total Fund’s financing</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1138 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">underlying financing structures that are by their nature </SPAN><NOBR>multi-country</NOBR> (covering two or more Member States) are not included in the above rule (i).</P>
<P class="p1139 ft23">The concentration limit shall be periodically reviewed and may be adjusted to reflect the evolving impact of the crisis and market needs in the different Member States. Any change of the concentration limit would be subject to approval by the Contributors Committee.</P>
<P class="p1140 ft23">For indirect products where the Fund’s investment will be combined with <NOBR>third-party</NOBR> resources, Financial Intermediaries will be required to invest at least the portion of their instrument provided for investment by the Fund in participating Member States<SPAN class="ft253">4</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1141 ft238">Investment Period:</P>
<P class="p1142 ft23">Operations may be submitted for approval to the Contributors Committee until 31 December 2021 (the “Investment Period”). The Fund will be established, provided that Member States accounting for at least 60% of EIB capital have made appropriate commitments to ensure sufficient scale and geographical coverage of the Fund.</P>
<P class="p1143 ft23">The EIB on account of the Fund and the EIF in the context of the Fund shall sign operations within the timescales foreseen by State aid rules applicable to the specific product concerned.</P>
<P class="p1134 ft23">A prolongation by 6 months could take place subject to approval of the Contributors’ Committee in accordance with the voting rules set out for key strategic changes in 12.2 below<SPAN class="ft253">5</SPAN>. Any further prolongation would be subject to unanimous approval within the Contributors Committee”.</P>
<P class="p1144 ft23">At the end of the Investment Period, following a proposal from EIB, the Contributors’ Committee shall determine whether a reduction in the outstanding commitment of the Contributors is appropriate given the overall commitments at that time.</P>
<P class="p1145 ft159">4. Permitted Instruments</P>
<P class="p1146 ft23">The Fund may deploy financial structures in both funded (e.g. loans, equity and <NOBR>quasi-equity</NOBR> investments, risk participations, ABS purchases) and unfunded (e.g. guarantees) form.</P>
<P class="p1147 ft23">Appendixes A - E (<SPAN class="ft169">Eligible Products</SPAN>) provide examples of the products that may be used under the Fund indicating the products to be deployed by EIB and EIF respectively.</P>
<P class="p1148 ft213"><SPAN class="ft241">3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft254">The below proposal assumes participation of all EU Member States and the specific number may be adjusted in case not all EU Member States decide to contribute.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1149 ft213"><SPAN class="ft241">4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft255">Effectively, these intermediaries may also invest outside the contributing Member States, but the amount invested in the contributing Member states would need to be at least equal to the support received from the Fund for investment.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1150 ft26"><SPAN class="ft241">5</SPAN><SPAN class="ft242">For the avoidance of doubt, the reference to “Contributions Paid” in Article 5(8) of the Platform Rules shall be understood as the Contribution committed to the Fund by each Member State</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1115 ft23">Additional products could be included subject to the approval of EIB’s Governing Bodies or respectively EIF’s Governing Bodies, including under applicable rules of delegation, and the approval of the Contributors’ Committee of the Fund in accordance with the voting rules set out in the Platform Rules or herein established.</P>
<P class="p1152 ft159">5. Results Framework</P>
<P class="p1153 ft26">A results framework for the activities financed by the Fund shall be prepared by EIB (“<SPAN class="ft97">Results Framework</SPAN>”). EIB shall report on the results of the Fund in accordance with the reporting framework described in Article 9.4 of the Platform Rules, except 9.4.1. (iv) as the financial reporting will not follow Platform Rules and shall instead be governed by the Contribution Agreement<SPAN class="ft19">.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1131 ft26">For the avoidance of doubt, article 2.2 of the Platform rules does not apply to operations deployed by the EIF in the context of the Fund under the EIB/EIF Arrangement (“EIF Operations”), for which a separate reporting methodology will apply. Article 9.4 of the Platform Rules apply to EIF Operations except as further specified in the EIB/EIF Arrangement Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1154 ft159">6. Evaluation</P>
<P class="p1115 ft23">EIB shall perform an evaluation of the Fund after the second anniversary of the end of its Investment Period. This evaluation will aim at making the Fund and the operations funded thereunder accountable to the Contributors and at promoting lessons learnt. The evaluation shall be shared with the Contributors’ Committee.</P>
<P class="p1152 ft159">7. Approval of operations</P>
<P class="p1118 ft23">All operations/ financing proposals are presented to the Contributors’ Committee of the Guarantee Fund.</P>
<P class="p1117 ft23">It is foreseen that the Contributors’ Committee shall approve the allocation of funds:</P>
<P class="p1155 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">For individual operations;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1156 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">For multiple operations, based on global authorisations to be granted by the Contributors’ Committee within certain parameters.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1157 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft207">For operations that do not fall within the envisaged global authorisations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1158 ft23">In relation to the Article 5.5. of the Platform Rules, each Contributor to the Fund is entitled to designate a member that shall represent such Contributor in the Contributors Committee. The governance provisions regarding the approval of operations are set out in Section 12.2 below.</P>
<P class="p1119 ft23">A procedure for consultation of the Commission will be applied for operations deployed by EIB, adjusted to the specific nature of the Fund. Accelerated selection and assessment procedures for existing financial intermediaries may also apply.</P>
<P class="p1159 ft159">8. Payment of Contributions</P>
<P class="p1160 ft160">The payment of Contributions is governed by the Platform Rules and the terms of each Contribution Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1161 ft23">Contributions of Member States to the Fund will take the form of a guarantee. Member States may elect to make an Upfront Payment. In addition, EIB expects to provide a suitable level of liquidity into the structure to allow for timely payments of amounts due by Member States.</P>
<P class="p1159 ft159">9. Fees</P>
<P class="p1162 ft97"><SPAN class="ft26">The Contributors agree that the </SPAN>advances made available to the Contributors under their liquidity facility <SPAN class="ft26">will be debited immediately to their respective Dedicated Register, the principal amount of such advances are </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft26">re-payable</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft26"> on their relevant Advance Repayment Date (as indicated in the</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1165 ft26">The Contributors agree as well that: costs, and expenses incurred by EIB and EIF and relevant fees due to EIB and EIF, as detailed below, are payable by the Contributors and shall be paid in the following order: first, from any Proceeds and Recoveries in line with the waterfall included in article 10 below; and, second, if and to the extent that the Proceeds and Recoveries are not sufficient, any shortfall relating to: (i) interest accrued on the liquidity facilities made available by EIB to the Contributors, (ii) Legal, Auditors and similar Costs, (iii) FX hedging costs, (iv) negative interest on the Contributor Cash Balance and on cash disbursed by EIB and EIF, and (v) EIB Funding Costs, will be covered pro rata by the Contributors, in accordance with the indemnity provisions under the Contribution Agreement and within the limit of the Contribution of each Contributor and in aggregate the Total Contributions and according to the following principles:</P>
<P class="p1166 ft97"><SPAN class="ft23">-</SPAN><SPAN class="ft256">(i) </SPAN>interest accrued on the liquidity facility made available from EIB to the Contributors<SPAN class="ft26">: will be covered </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft26">pro-rata</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft26"> by the Contributors who benefitted from the liquidity facility;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1167 ft159"><SPAN class="ft23">-</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">(ii) negative interest on the Contributor Cash Balance</SPAN><SPAN class="ft23">; will be covered </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft23">pro-rata</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft23"> by the Contributors who made an Upfront Payment or an additional cash contribution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1168 ft159"><SPAN class="ft23">-</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">(iii) Legal, Auditors and similar Costs, FX hedging costs, </SPAN><SPAN class="ft23">negative interest on cash disbursed by EIB and EIF </SPAN>and EIB Funding Costs: <SPAN class="ft23">will be covered </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft23">pro-rata</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft23"> by all Contributors;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1169 ft159"><SPAN class="ft23">-</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">(iv) No draw down under the liquidity facility will be allowed to cover the items set out above</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1170 ft160">To operationally manage this, a portion of the total commitments will initially be reserved as a buffer to cover costs and expenses</P>
<P class="p1171 ft26">No recourse to the liquidity facility or the indemnity provisions under the Contribution Agreement will be allowed for Management Fees, and Recovery Fees, hence EIB has no recourse to the Contributors to cover shortfalls of Management Fees and Recovery Fees. Also, if any portion of Management Fees, and Recovery Fees remains unpaid under the waterfall when allocated at the end of each quarter, such unpaid amounts will roll over to the next quarter (and so forth) and will be due and payable in the following quarter (and so forth), following the same order of payment.</P>
<P class="p1172 ft258">Costs and Fees to be paid by the Contributors in accordance with the general principles above and the waterfall below</P>
<P class="p1173 ft159">Funding Costs<SPAN class="ft23">:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1174 ft213">Funding Cost shall comprise interest determined at the rate of: (i) EURIBOR 3 month for operations in EUR, or <NOBR>X-ibor</NOBR> 3 month for other operations, plus (ii) a spread (which can be a positive or negative number of basis points) calculated following EIB's standard pricing methodology recovering EIB's cost of funding on the capital markets and its administrative costs applicable to this type of operations; with</P>
<P class="p1175 ft23">(i) and (ii) in aggregate floored at zero.</P>
<P class="p1176 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">Management Fee</SPAN>: means from the signature date of the first Contribution Agreement until 31 December 2037, the annual management fee which shall be paid by the Fund to the EIB and EIF (“<SPAN class="ft159">Management Fee</SPAN>”) and shall be equal to up to 0.5 (up to zero point five) % of the aggregate of the Committed Amounts under the Transactions subject to an overall aggregate cap of two point five (2.5) % of Total Contributions.</P>
<P class="p1149 ft228"><SPAN class="ft227">Committed Amounts </SPAN>mean the aggregate of the amounts committed by EIB or EIF in relation to operations signed by EIB or EIF for the account of the Fund which are outstanding (but excluding any outstanding defaulted amounts or cancelled amounts). The Committed Amounts shall not be reduced in the event that there has been any provisioning for losses or reduction in market value due to market value fluctuations of the relevant exposures.</P>
<P class="p1177 ft23">Such level of fees have been calculated on the basis of ensuring EIB cost coverage and EIF remuneration in line with statutory requirements.</P>

<P class="p1115 ft23">The Management Fee shall be calculated as if all the Contributors had committed on the date of the first Contribution Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1179 ft159">Legal, Audit, Consultant and similar Expenses</P>
<P class="p1161 ft23">Include costs, fees and expenses of EIB and EIF external lawyers, auditors, consultants (including in the context of the structuring of and the transactions and operations performed in relation to the Fund) and similar costs, fees, and expenses (including costs, fees and expenses to cover investment fees and costs for the investment of the Cash Balance).</P>
<P class="p1157 ft159">Recovery Fee</P>
<P class="p1161 ft23">EIB and EIF shall charge to the Fund a <NOBR>flat-fee</NOBR> recovery fee for operations that EIB or EIF needs to recover amounts or in case that it applies a restructuring. The recovery fee shall be calculated at the rate of 1% of disbursed but not recovered amounts, subject to an overall aggregate cap of zero point five (0.5) % of Total Contributions</P>
<P class="p1180 ft159">10. Distributions Waterfall</P>
<P class="p1181 ft26">Any cash flows received under a debt operation of the Fund (other than amounts qualifying as Recovery or Proceeds) that are classified as principal in accordance with EIB’s accounting policies shall be allocated to the reduction of the principal outstanding of the Loan or, for EIF funded debt products, the funding line made available from EIB to EIF to perform funded operations of the Fund.</P>
<P class="p1182 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">Loan </SPAN>means the loan/credit facility or facilities made available by the Bank to the Fund to provide financing for the underlying funded transactions.</P>
<P class="p1183 ft26"><SPAN class="ft97">Proceeds </SPAN>mean any interest, fees, profits, and Recoveries received under the underlying transactions and, for equity transactions, any reflows (including restitution of commitment and distributions).</P>
<P class="p1184 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">Recoveries </SPAN>means moneys recovered from underlying transactions.</P>
<P class="p1185 ft23">Proceeds and Recoveries received under an operation of the Fund shall be allocated by the Bank acting on the account of the Fund at the end of each quarter 31 March, 30 June, 30 September, 31 December between the Contributors and the EIB and EIF as follows:</P>
<P class="p1186 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">firstly, to EIB and EIF for Management Fees as apportioned to the quarter in accordance with ACT/360, and Recovery Fees</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1187 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">secondly, to EIB and EIF for EIB/EIF Legal Audit, Consultant and similar Expenses</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1188 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">thirdly, to EIB and EIF for FX hedging costs and foreclosure costs and for negative interest on EIB or EIF disbursed amounts, if any;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1189 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">fourthly to the EIB for the aggregate interest accrued on the Contributor liquidity facilities (if any) made available by EIB and for the aggregate negative interest on the Contributor Cash Balances, pro rata to each other;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1190 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">fifthly, to EIB for the accrued Funding Cost on the Loan or funding line made available from EIB to EIF and/ or in the context of the Fund;</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1201 ft159">11. Amendments to Fund Description</P>
<P class="p1202 ft26">This Fund Description may be amended from time to time, subject to approval of the Contributors’ Committee of the fund in accordance with the voting rules set out in Article 5 (8) of the Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1203 ft160">EIB may, at its own discretion, amend the provisions of this Fund Description to the extent such amendments result from the change in EIB’s and EIF’s rules and policies or from the regulations applicable to EIB’s and EIF’s activities or from the decisions of EIB’s and EIF’s Governing Bodies (“<SPAN class="ft159">Obligatory Amendments</SPAN>”). If one or more Contributors object(s) to the introduction of the Obligatory Amendments, these Contributors can engage into discussions with EIB regarding the Contribution Agreement they entered into with EIB, if the Obligatory Amendments:</P>
<P class="p1169 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft231">prevent such Contributor(s) continuing to participate in the Fund in compliance with the laws and regulations applicable to it;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1204 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft262">require the Contributor(s) to increase the amount of their Contributions; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1205 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft263">substantially increase their costs of further participation in the Fund.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1206 ft159">12. Special Provisions</P>
