<P class="p1209 ft238">12,2 Governance</P>
<P class="p1210 ft23">Acknowledging the exceptional nature of the instrument, higher <NOBR>decision-making</NOBR> thresholds than under standard Platform Rules will be applied. Decisions on the use of the guarantee for individual transactions outside the global authorisations will be taken by a qualified majority of contributions, i.e. 50% of contributors representing 2/3% share of contributions.</P>
<P class="p1211 ft23">Key strategic decisions, including changes in the product or beneficiary mix as set out in sections 3 and 4 of this Fund Description, require a supermajority of contributions, i.e. 50% of contributors representing 80% share of contributions.</P>
<P class="p1212 ft238">12.3 Currency of Contributions and fees</P>
<P class="p1130 ft23">All Contributions as well as fees will be paid in EUR.</P>
<P class="p1117 ft238">12.4 Due Diligence process and EIB Group processes</P>
<P class="p1213 ft23">In light of the extraordinary situation, namely the severe travel limitations, as well as the need for swift channelling of the Fund to the real economy, simplified (namely <NOBR>desk-top)</NOBR> due diligence can be used under certain circumstances. Such circumstances will be clearly spelled out as part of approval process.</P>
<P class="p1179 ft238">12.5 Workouts and restructurings</P>
<P class="p1153 ft26">In relation to operations comprising an investment, EIB and EIF are authorised, including in the context of an insolvency or restructuring of an investee, and/or for the purposes of improving the collectability or recovery of any claims against any, and/or to avoid any default by an investee, to amend the terms and conditions of any operation supported by the Fund, and to grant any waiver or forgiveness, even if such amendment, waiver or forgiveness causes a loss to the Fund, provided that EIB or EIF has acted in accordance with its rules, policies and procedures, as applicable.</P>
<P class="p1116 ft23">Indirect Operations will envisage full delegation to the Financial Intermediary with respect to servicing of the underlying exposures. The Financial Intermediary will need to act in accordance with its rules, policies and procedures, applicable from time to time.</P>
<P class="p1212 ft238">12.6 Guarantee servicing fee</P>
<P class="p1213 ft23">To minimise crowding out and to ensure compliance with EU State Aid Framework, some of the EIB Group proposed products will be implemented on a remunerated basis. The guarantee servicing fees will be applied and charged to the Financial Intermediaries.</P>
<P class="p1214 ft238">12.7 Risk appetite for Financial Instruments</P>
<P class="p1118 ft23">The fund will be continuously managed so as to keep ex ante net expected loss on guarantee commitments at 20% for the Fund as a whole. The EIBG will put in place a strong ex ante risk- management system and ensure regular ex post reporting to the Contributors Committee on all matters related to risk.</P>
<P class="p1179 ft238">Risk appetite for EIB Financial Instruments</P>
<P class="p1215 ft23">The Fund is designed to be a <NOBR>high-risk</NOBR> intervention and the underlying operations are expected to present a higher level of risk for the Fund than that generally taken by EIB in relation to operations it carries out at its own risk. As a result, Article 12.3 (The Bank acting in specific circumstances) of the Platform Rules shall apply.</P>
<P class="p1211 ft160">Due to the specific characteristics of the operations to be financed or guaranteed by the Fund, EIB’s rules, policies and procedures applied to operations it carries out at its own risk shall not be applicable to the operations, including the provisions of EIB’s Credit Risk Guidelines (“CRGs”), the EIB’s Equity Risk Guidelines (“ERGs”) and the pricing and valuation methodology applicable to operations EIB carries out at its own risk.</P>

<P class="p1217 ft23">EIB shall apply the provisions laid down in the general mandate risk principles for impact finance mandates, included in the relevant section of the CRGs and ERGs. When applying the provisions referred to in this paragraph, EIB shall:</P>
<P class="p1218 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft202">Make a Qualitative Assessment (i) in case of Indirect Operations of the suitability of an eligible Financial Intermediary’s risk management framework, systems policies and procedures to implement operations and enter into the relevant </SPAN><NOBR>sub-operations</NOBR> or the final recipient transactions and (ii) in case of Direct Operations, of the soundness of the investment rationale and plausible business viability of such operations;</P>
<P class="p1219 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft202">Set a pricing of the operations under the Fund using its expert judgement taking into account its Qualitative Assessment and consistent with the Fund’s objectives and, if applicable, after reviewing the pricing of </SPAN><NOBR>co-financiers</NOBR> taking similar risk to the financial product on the operation, and State Aid rules where applicable. For these financial products, the Contributors and EIB acknowledge that there is no established market for this type of operations. The pricing of the operations under the Fund may be different from the pricing applicable to operations EIB carries out at its own risk.</P>
<P class="p1220 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft222">For Indirect Operations, fully delegate implementation of the transactions, including the pricing of the </SPAN><NOBR>(sub-)operations</NOBR> to the Financial <NOBR>(Sub-)Intermediaries</NOBR> to apply their own rules, policies and procedures. The Financial <NOBR>(Sub-)Intermediaries</NOBR> may be required to adjust certain terms or their pricing in order to pass on any financial advantage to the final recipients under the transactions. For some products, the Financial <NOBR>(Sub-)</NOBR> Intermediaries shall charge a flat fee to the final recipients. The level of delegation to the Financial <NOBR>(Sub-)Intermediaries</NOBR> to apply their own rules, policies and procedures may exceed the one applicable to operations the EIB carries out at its own risk.</P>
<P class="p1133 ft23">Whereby a “Qualitative Assessment” is defined as “the risk assessment performed by the EIB in accordance with the general mandate risk principles for impact finance mandates included in the relevant section of the CRG or the ERG, and as further described in this article”.</P>
<P class="p1221 ft23">An adjusted financial monitoring, restructuring and recovery management from what applicable to operations EIB carries out at its own risk shall be applicable to the operations under the Fund.</P>

<P class="p1223 ft23">For financial products implemented by EIF, EIF will apply its rules, policies and procedures for such financial products which may differ from the rules, policies and procedures applied to operations EIF carries out for its own operations.</P>
<P class="p1224 ft23">The foreign exchange risk arising from any conversion in the context of operations under the Fund shall be borne by the Fund.</P>

<P class="p1214 ft238">12.8 Special Measures</P>
<P class="p1227 ft160">Given the special purpose of EGF as a crisis response instrument, EIB may adapt its usual contractual and eligibility requirements on a <NOBR>ring-fenced</NOBR> basis to allow for operations that address the main symptoms of the current crisis like supply chain support, working capital and liquidity needs. When working with financial intermediaries under full delegation, EIB may also adapt its usual contractual requirements for monitoring, restructuring, reporting, compliance, exclusions and fraud with regards to the final beneficiaries. Any such adaptation would be clearly spelled out in the approval documents at operation level.</P>
<P class="p1228 ft238">12.9 Negative interest rate risk</P>
<P class="p1229 ft23">There will be two main sources of negative interest rate risk in the structure:</P>
<P class="p1230 ft23">1- Negative interest rate risk related to upfront contributions to the Fund: Some of the Contributors may elect to make an upfront contribution to the Fund. In the current negative interest rate environment for EUR, such upfront contributions would reduce over time as a result of negative interest rates.</P>
<P class="p1152 ft23">2- Negative interest rate risk related to recoveries or repayments from the underlying operations.</P>
<P class="p1130 ft238">12.10 Financial, operational and risk reporting</P>
<P class="p1227 ft160">As per the financial reporting requirements of the Fund defined under the Contribution Agreement, a cash based financial reporting is prepared and therefore no valuation of the operations of the Fund is foreseen. As foreseen under the Contribution Agreement, upon receipt of the financial reporting documents, the Contributor may request additional information related to the content of the documents. The Bank shall use its reasonable efforts to provide the Contributor with the information deemed necessary provided that the relevant information is available to the Bank and subject to having resources to gather such information.</P>
<P class="p1115 ft23">The Contributors Committee and the Board will receive an annual Operational Report on Guarantee Fund operations. This operational report will contain a list of every supported signed operation/contract, combined with tables showing signatures per sector, per country and expected Investment Mobilised with the associated financing multiplier.</P>
<P class="p1179 ft23">The Contributor’s Committee will receive regular <NOBR>ex-post</NOBR> reporting on matters related to risk.</P>
<P class="p1117 ft238">12.10 EIF policies and procedures</P>
<P class="p1115 ft23">In the context of the Fund and in particular, in relation to the assessment, approval, implementation, reporting and exit/termination of operations, EIF will apply its internal rules and procedures, where relevant as modified by the agreed upon procedures applicable to EIF Operations in the context of the Fund, as approved by EIF governing bodies.</P>

<P class="p1245 ft213"><SPAN class="ft241">6</SPAN><SPAN class="ft255">The supply chain product is in substance a </SPAN><NOBR>short-term</NOBR> loan to a Borrower (typically a <NOBR>Mid-Cap</NOBR> or large corporate) that works in a triangular relationship as follows :</P>
<P class="p1246 ft213"><SPAN class="ft274">‐</SPAN><SPAN class="ft275">The suppliers (usually SMEs) provide services/goods to the buyer (the Borrower, i.e. the </SPAN><NOBR>Mid-Cap</NOBR> or large corporate) and issue invoices for the services/goods provided to the buyer.</P>
<P class="p1247 ft213"><SPAN class="ft274">‐</SPAN><SPAN class="ft275">The buyer verifies the validity of the invoices and notifies these invoices to the Financial Intermediary.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1247 ft273"><SPAN class="ft276">‐</SPAN><SPAN class="ft277">Invoices confirmed are paid by the Financial Intermediary to the suppliers.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1247 ft273"><SPAN class="ft276">‐</SPAN><SPAN class="ft277">The buyer repays the Financial Intermediary for the amounts advanced to the suppliers.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1248 ft26">Hence, the supply chain product, although extended to <NOBR>Mid-Caps</NOBR> or large corporates, it is effectively a tool to support SMEs.</P>

<P class="p1309 ft177">Appendix E – EIF Equity Products</P>
<P class="p1310 ft159">EIF <NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> EQUITY RESPONSE MEASURE # 1: <SPAN class="ft177">EXISTING FUNDS </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft177">TOP-UP</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft177"> FACILITY (TUF)</SPAN></P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t105">

	<TD class="tr5 td379"><P class="p23 ft300">Product name</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td380"><P class="p3 ft23">Existing Funds <NOBR>Top-Up</NOBR> Facility</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr30 td381"><P class="p3 ft296"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr30 td382"><P class="p3 ft296"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td383"><P class="p23 ft300">Product family</P></TD>

</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td381"><P class="p3 ft286"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td382"><P class="p3 ft286"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr19 td383"><P class="p23 ft300">Policy rationale and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td384"><P class="p3 ft26">The <NOBR>long-term</NOBR> impact on SMEs and <NOBR>Mid-Caps</NOBR> supported by Venture Capital (VC) and</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr19 td383"><P class="p23 ft300">strategic objective</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td384"><P class="p3 ft160">Private Equity (PE) across the EU will depend on the length and severity of the</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td383"><P class="p3 ft217"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td384"><P class="p3 ft213"><NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> crisis. However, a number of companies are already very strongly affected</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td383"><P class="p3 ft217"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td384"><P class="p3 ft213">and will continue to be impacted in the <NOBR>short-term.</NOBR> Due to specifics of the VC/PE</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr36 td383"><P class="p3 ft18"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr36 td384"><P class="p3 ft26">industry, these companies require dedicated and <NOBR>tailor-made</NOBR> <NOBR>equity-like</NOBR> support.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr19 td383"><P class="p3 ft18"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td384"><P class="p3 ft26">TUF will be primarily used to support VC and PE funds in EIF’s portfolio which have</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td383"><P class="p3 ft217"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td384"><P class="p3 ft228">limited or insufficient remaining undrawn capital to support SME and <NOBR>Mid-Cap</NOBR></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr36 td383"><P class="p3 ft18"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr36 td384"><P class="p3 ft23">companies in their investment portfolios.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1311 ft160">Specifically the products under TUF will contribute to:</P>
<P class="p1312 ft23"><SPAN class="ft54">∙</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Supporting financially sound existing portfolio companies experiencing short/mid- term liquidity issues combined with increased risk of insolvency;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1313 ft23"><SPAN class="ft54">∙</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Helping avoid portfolio companies having to sell off otherwise promising companies’ assets at depressed valuations to provide needed </SPAN><NOBR>short-term</NOBR> liquidity; and</P>
<P class="p1314 ft23"><SPAN class="ft54">∙</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Ensuring stability and availability of </SPAN><NOBR>follow-on</NOBR> capital for further growth of performing companies.</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t106">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td379"><P class="p23 ft300">Estimated leverage</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td380"><P class="p3 ft23">2.9x</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr15 td381"><P class="p3 ft27"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr15 td382"><P class="p3 ft27"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr36 td383"><P class="p23 ft300">Structure</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr36 td384"><P class="p3 ft26">TUF shall make available equity or hybrid debt equity funding to fund managers in or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td383"><P class="p3 ft217"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td384"><P class="p3 ft213">alongside their existing funds to support companies in their existing portfolios through</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr36 td383"><P class="p3 ft18"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr36 td384"><P class="p3 ft23"><NOBR>follow-on</NOBR> investments.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1315 ft228">TUF will be structured through two deployment modalities, which depending on the situation will be better fitted to achieve the Policy Objectives.</P>
<P class="p1316 ft161"><SPAN class="ft54">∙</SPAN><SPAN class="ft301">TUF 1 – </SPAN><SPAN class="ft302">Side vehicle </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft302">top-ups</SPAN>:</NOBR> Such increased commitments to EIF portfolio funds are to be structured through side vehicles which shall invest in <NOBR>follow-on</NOBR> investments in existing portfolio companies. These increased commitments will expand the ability of the fund manager to perform <NOBR>follow-on</NOBR> investments and will be dedicated to supporting a subset of promising companies most in need of support (from one or <NOBR>multiple-generation</NOBR> funds managed by the fund manager).</P>
<P class="p1317 ft23"><SPAN class="ft54">∙</SPAN><SPAN class="ft303">TUF 2 – </SPAN><SPAN class="ft238">Preferred equity </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft238">top-ups</SPAN>:</NOBR> To provide additional resources to EIF portfolio funds, EIF shall subscribe to a <NOBR>top-up</NOBR> on more senior terms relative to existing investors. The investment may entitle EIF to a liquidation priority (ie. will be reimbursed in advance of existing investors), carry a contractually agreed preferred return and potentially also a participation in the upside. The investment will carry a lower risk than existing investors, but also entitle EIF to a lower share of the upside.</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t107">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr36 td379"><P class="p23 ft300">Final recipients</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr36 td380"><P class="p3 ft26">Eligible final recipients include SMEs, Small <NOBR>Mid-caps,</NOBR> and <NOBR>Mid-caps</NOBR> established or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td383"><P class="p3 ft18"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td384"><P class="p3 ft23">operating in the EU Member States.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td383"><P class="p3 ft18"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td384"><P class="p3 ft26">TUF is expected to finance predominantly portfolio companies: i) to overcome short</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td383"><P class="p3 ft217"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td384"><P class="p3 ft228">and <NOBR>mid-term</NOBR> liquidity constrains resulting from loss of revenue, ii) to increase</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td383"><P class="p3 ft18"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td384"><P class="p3 ft23">production capacity, and iii) to finance market or product development.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1318 ft23">In terms of stage, the facility is expected to focus more prominently on one or more of the stages listed below:</P>

<P class="p1355 ft91">WHEREAS:</P>
<P class="p1356 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft202">Considering the need to increase financial flows for sustainable development, and building on t h e successful experience of the European Investment Bank (the “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Bank</SPAN>” or the “<SPAN class="ft159">EIB</SPAN>”) in combining its lending operations with instruments facilitating project preparation and implementation, through the Bank’s current portfolio of trust funds and blending facilities, the Bank has decided to set up an <NOBR>EIB-managed</NOBR> multi- region, <NOBR>multi-contributor</NOBR> and <NOBR>multi-sector</NOBR> Partnerships Platform for Funds (the <SPAN class="ft159">“Platform”</SPAN>). The Platform is established also in anticipation of an increasing volume of funds that would require ensuring <NOBR>cost-efficiency</NOBR> of the related management activities.</P>
<P class="p1357 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">The principal objective of the Platform is to strengthen operational efficiency by streamlining and standardising, to the extent feasible, processes and procedures, governance arrangements, fee calculation methodologies, and reporting standards applicable to the assets under the Bank’s management in respect of this Platform.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1358 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft202">Operations under the Platform shall be organised through the contractual establishment of individual pools of assets (each a “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Fund</SPAN>” and collectively the “<SPAN class="ft159">Funds</SPAN>”). The Bank shall arrange for Funds to be set up in collaboration with interested contributors, in order to address regional and sectoral priorities. These rules (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Platform Rules</SPAN>”) shall apply to each new Fund to be set up under the Platform. Moreover, a Fund description shall be provided in a contribution agreement to be entered into between each contributor and the Bank to reflect specific objectives, requirements and eligibilities applicable to each Fund.</P>
<P class="p1359 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">For the avoidance of doubt, despite the fact that the contractual relationship between the Bank and contributors may use terms such as “fund”, “trust” or “trust funds”, it is not the intention of the Bank to create, and these Platform Rules do not set up, any investment fund, trust or similar legal arrangement under the Platform.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1360 ft321">ARTICLE 1</P>
<P class="p1361 ft321">DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION</P>
<P class="p1362 ft159">1.1 Definitions</P>
<P class="p1363 ft161"><SPAN class="ft162">“Account” </SPAN>means, with respect to a Contribution Agreement, the bank account indicated by the Bank in that Contribution Agreement to which the relevant Contributor shall transfer the relevant Contribution in accordance with the terms of that Contribution Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1364 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Administrator” </SPAN>means the EIB in its capacity of the administrator of the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1364 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Article” </SPAN>means an article of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1365 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Business Day” </SPAN>means a day during which the EIB is open for business at its seat in Luxembourg.</P>
<P class="p1365 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Contribution” </SPAN>means funds committed by each Contributor to a Fund established under the Platform pursuant to the Contribution Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1366 ft244">51</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">258</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_259">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p705 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1367 ft161"><SPAN class="ft162">“Contribution Agreement” </SPAN>means an agreement between the EIB and each Contributor based on which Contributions are to be made to a Fund under the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1368 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Contribution Paid” </SPAN>means the Contribution transferred by the Contributor to the Account and received by the Bank.</P>
<P class="p1369 ft323"><SPAN class="ft322">“Contributor” </SPAN>means any Member State of the European Union as well as the European Commission, and the EFTA Countries that contribute funds to a Fund under the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1370 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Contributors’ Committee” </SPAN>means a committee established in accordance with Article 5.4 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1371 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“EFTA Countries” </SPAN>means countries that are members of the European Free Trade Association.</P>
<P class="p1372 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Eligible Operations” </SPAN>means operations approved in accordance with Article 6.5 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1369 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Fund Account” </SPAN>means, in respect of a Fund, the account denominated in euro opened by the EIB in its books for the purpose of managing the Contributions Paid.</P>
<P class="p1372 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Fund Description” </SPAN>means a document annexed to the Contribution Agreement where the objectives to be pursued under each Fund, its indicative budget, as well as eligible operations are specified.</P>
<P class="p1372 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Fund Outstanding Balance” </SPAN>means, for any Fund, the balance of the respective Fund Account.</P>
<P class="p1372 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Instrument” </SPAN>means each of the instruments specified in Article 4.6 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1373 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Legal Framework” </SPAN>means the Platform Rules, each Contribution Agreement and each Fund Description that constitute a legal basis for the cooperation between the EIB and the Contributors in relation to the management of Contributions.</P>
<P class="p1372 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Partnerships Committee” </SPAN>means a committee established in accordance with Article 5.3 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1374 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Platform Outstanding Balance” </SPAN>means the sum of the Fund Outstanding Balances.</P>
<P class="p1375 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Resources” </SPAN>means the sum of (i) the aggregated amount of any Contribution Paid,</P>
<P class="p1376 ft161"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft324">any revenues and repayments generated by the activities of the Platform and credited to the relevant Fund Account, and (iii) any revenues generated by the asset management by the EIB of the assets constituting the Platform Outstanding Balance and credited to the relevant Fund Accounts, </SPAN><NOBR>pro-rata</NOBR> the Funds Outstanding Balances.</P>
<P class="p1371 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Third Party” </SPAN>means any entity other than those defined as Contributors, such as a country other than a Member States of the European Union and EFTA Countries, international financial institutions, funds, foundations, private sector and banking entities contributing funds to a Fund under the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1377 ft244">52</P>

<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1378 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Third Party Agreement” </SPAN>means an agreement pursuant to which Third Party Financing is contributed to a Fund under the Platform, as defined in Article 2 of Annex I <SPAN class="ft169">“Receipt of Third Party Financing” </SPAN>to these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1379 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Third Party Financing” </SPAN>means funds contributed to a Fund under the Platform by a Third Party, subject to the provisions of Annex I <SPAN class="ft169">“Receipt of Third Party Financing” </SPAN>to these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1379 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Unitary Fund” </SPAN>means the pooled investment portfolio established by the EIB by the Deed Poll of 1 July 2009, as supplemented and amended from time to time and as defined in the corresponding Information Memorandum.</P>
<P class="p1380 ft159">1.2 Interpretation</P>
<P class="p1362 ft23">Subject to Article 1.1 of these Platform Rules and save where the context otherwise requires:</P>
<P class="p1381 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft219">capitalised terms and expressions defined in the Preamble have the same meaning throughout these Platform Rules, unless herein otherwise defined;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1382 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft219">words denoting:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">the singular number only shall include the plural number also and vice versa;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p12 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">one gender only shall include the other gender; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p560 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft325">persons only shall include firms and corporations and vice versa.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1383 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft285">any provision of any primary or derivative legislation shall be deemed also to refer to any modification thereof;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1382 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft219">headings shall be ignored in construing these Platform Rules; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1382 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft263">the Annexes form an integral part of these Platform Rules and shall have effect accordingly.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1384 ft321">ARTICLE 2</P>
<P class="p1385 ft321">INTRODUCTION</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Platform is set up by the EIB to administer externally contributed resources that shall be used to facilitate the EIB’s activities across the full range of countries and sectors and using the full range of instruments described in Article 4.6 of these Platform Rules, through the establishment of the respective Funds under the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">2.1 Policy framework</P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">Operations supported with the resources contributed to the Funds established under the Platform shall be consistent with the objectives, policies, guidelines and principles, as amended from time to time, applicable to the EIB’s activities, and including, but not limited to, the following:</P>

<P class="p1390 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">2.1.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Main objectives</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1391 ft23">Main objectives include the following:</P>
<P class="p1392 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Promoting growth and development in beneficiary countries;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p516 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Supporting the EU enlargement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p516 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Supporting strategic partnerships and security;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p636 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Reducing and eventually eradicating poverty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p636 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Supporting the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals</SPAN><SPAN class="ft183">10</SPAN>;</P>
<P class="p516 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Development of social and economic infrastructure;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p516 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Local private sector development;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p516 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Climate change mitigation and adaptation; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p516 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">Regional integration.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1393 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">2.1.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Applicable policies, guidelines and principles</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">The management of the Platform as well as of the respective Funds established thereunder shall be performed with the application of the EIB’s internal policies and guidelines, such as environmental, social and gender policies, as well as those related to <NOBR>anti-fraud,</NOBR> fight against <SPAN class="ft162">tax evasion, tax avoidance, </SPAN>harmful tax practices, <NOBR>anti-money</NOBR> laundering and fight against financing of terrorism, market abuse, <NOBR>non-cooperation</NOBR> with <NOBR>non-transparent</NOBR> and uncooperative jurisdictions<SPAN class="ft162">, </SPAN>procurement and transparency policies<SPAN class="ft326">11</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">It should be noted that several <NOBR>cross-cutting</NOBR> principles are also applicable to the EIB activities, and consequently shall also be applicable to the operations supported through the resources contributed to the Funds under the Platform, including the following:</P>
<P class="p1395 ft161"><SPAN class="ft23">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft327">Protection of human rights and safeguarding against social, climate and environmental risks that should be achieved by ensuring compliance with the EIB’s environmental and social standards, as well as the EIB’s Climate Action Statement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1396 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Protection of women’s rights that should be achieved through the application of the EIB’s social standards, and the promotion of gender equality and women’s economic empowerment based on the implementation of the EIB Group Gender Equality Strategy;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1397 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">Avoiding investments being impacted by, or indeed triggering, conflict, social tensions and violence through the application of a conflict sensitivity approach to operations in fragile, </SPAN><NOBR>conflict-affected</NOBR> or <NOBR>conflict-prone</NOBR> contexts;</P>
<P class="p1398 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Ownership that should be ensured through consultations with the beneficiary countries and ensuring the alignment and complementarity of operations with relevant regional, national and local strategies and priorities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1395 ft161"><SPAN class="ft23">e)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft327">Cost-Sharing</SPAN></NOBR> that should be achieved through ensuring that, whenever possible, final beneficiaries shall make an appropriate contribution to the operations financed under</P>
<P class="p1399 ft274"><SPAN class="ft241">10</SPAN><SPAN class="ft328">The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) is a set of 17 "Global Goals" with 169 targets between them. Spearheaded by the United Nations through a deliberative process involving its 193 Member States, as well as global civil society, the goals are contained in paragraph 54 United Nations Resolution A/RES/70/1 of 25 September 2015.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p516 ft331"><SPAN class="ft241">11</SPAN><SPAN class="ft329">Further details available on: </SPAN><SPAN class="ft330">http://www.eib.org/about/partners/cso/key‐policies/</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1400 ft244">54</P>
</DIV>

<P class="p14 ft3">261</P>
</DIV>

<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1401 ft23">the Platform in accordance with modalities to be determined by the Contributors and the Bank;</P>
<P class="p1356 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">f)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft332">Cost-Efficiency</SPAN></NOBR> that should be achieved by ensuring that only a justifiable proportion of grants/subsidies/guarantees shall be provided along other sources of financing. It shall be ensured that the costs of implementation of the operations shall always be reasonable;</P>
<P class="p1356 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Sustainability that should be achieved by seeking to ensure an improved local capacity by transferring knowledge to final beneficiaries and maintaining the impact of the investment also beyond the life of the operation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1402 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Catalytic Impact that should be achieved by ensuring that resources are provided only for activities that can contribute to the subsequent mobilisation of additional funds, partners, or further assistance in supported areas; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1403 ft323"><SPAN class="ft26">i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft333">Promotion of open market that should be achieved by ensuring that overcompensation is avoided and that supported operations do not distort the functioning of the market.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1404 ft159">2.2 Expected Results and Impact</P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">The following section provides the list of results and describes impact that the operations supported through the resources contributed to the Funds under the Platform are expected to achieve. Such results and impacts include the following:</P>
<P class="p1364 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Leverage of the overall investment</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1405 ft161">Appropriate leverage may allow to implement investments that would otherwise not take place, to accelerate their implementation, or to increase their chances of success. Through leverage the scope and scale of the overall investment may also be increased to deliver a larger impact than would otherwise be the case, extend the benefits to a wider group of final beneficiaries, especially the poor and vulnerable groups, and boost private sector investments that may otherwise not be engaged.</P>
<P class="p1364 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft219">Economic benefits</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1406 ft23">Economic benefits include the creation or sustainability of jobs, boost of economic growth, purse of reforms and a transition to a market economy.</P>
<P class="p1407 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Financial benefits</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1406 ft23">Financial benefits include broadening access to finance to target groups, improvement of financial viability, lowering <NOBR>end-user</NOBR> tariffs.</P>
<P class="p1364 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Social benefits</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1408 ft23">Social benefits include the limitation of affordability constraints for low income households, economic inclusion and social wellbeing, gender equality, inclusive public consultations.</P>
<P class="p1409 ft244">55</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">262</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_263">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p705 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1410 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Environmental impact</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1411 ft323">Environmental impact relates to an enhanced consideration of the environmental dimension of the investment and higher environmental standards achieved.</P>
<P class="p1412 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft219">Promotion of innovation</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1413 ft161">Promotion of innovation includes focus on innovative proposals, which do not necessarily require large amounts of resources but can provide high value added to the beneficiary countries, and operations aimed at supporting vulnerable groups through innovation (e.g. digital technology and financial inclusion of women).</P>
<P class="p1414 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">Other benefits</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1415 ft23">Other benefits may include positive externalities realised by the operation, which would not happen without the presence of the funding component, including addressing market failures and avoiding market distortions, decentralization and commercialization activities.</P>
<P class="p1022 ft321">ARTICLE 3</P>
<P class="p1416 ft321">THE PLATFORM SET UP</P>
<P class="p1391 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Eligible Contributors</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1417 ft23">Any Member State of the European Union as well as the European Commission, and the EFTA Countries can make Contribution(s) to a Fund under the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1418 ft161">Third Party Financing is subject to approval by the EIB and the relevant Fund’s Contributors’ Committee. Third Parties shall enter into a Third Party Agreement with the Bank for the purpose of contributing Third Party Financing to a Fund under the Platform. Unless otherwise provided in these Platform Rules or in Annex I <SPAN class="ft334">“Receipt of Third Party Financing” </SPAN>to these Platform Rules, or unless otherwise agreed by the parties to a Third Party Agreement, these Platform Rules shall apply to each Third Party.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Contributions</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1391 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.2.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Legal Framework applicable to Contributions</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1417 ft23">Contribution(s) shall be contributed by each Contributor pursuant to a Contribution Agreement which shall specify the amount of the respective Contribution and its payment schedule.</P>
<P class="p1418 ft161">Objectives to be pursued under each Fund, its indicative budget, as well as eligible operations shall be defined in the Fund Description annexed to the Contribution Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">By entering into a Contribution Agreement, the Contributor shall be deemed to acknowledge, agree, and undertake to continuously comply with any and all terms and conditions of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1421 ft244">56</P>
</DIV>

<P class="p14 ft3">263</P>

<P class="p1404 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.2.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft335">Time schedule for Contributions</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Contributions can be provided at any time during the term of a Fund under the Platform, upon execution of a Contribution Agreement between the Bank and the relevant Contributor and subject to the terms thereof. A Contributor may at any time increase the amount of its Contribution upon the execution of a further Contribution Agreement between the Bank and the Contributor and subject to the terms thereof. The provisions of these Platform Rules relating to Contributions shall apply equally to additional Contributions with respect to that same Fund.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">By entering into a Contribution Agreement, the Contributor irrevocably and unconditionally undertakes to make the Contribution described therein on the relevant Contribution payment dates, as defined in the Contribution Agreement, and allow the EIB, as the Administrator, to proceed with the allocation of the relevant Contribution Paid, subject to any fees, costs, charges, and losses, to operations according to the scheduled payment dates specified in that Contribution Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1382 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.2.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft335">Payment of Contributions and Third Party Financing</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Each Contribution and each Third Party Financing shall be (a) denominated and paid exclusively in euro and (b) paid by the relevant Contributor or Third Party, as the case may be, in accordance with the terms of the applicable Contribution Agreement or Third Party Agreement, in the form of:</P>
<P class="p1382 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">a single instalment; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1422 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">in several instalments as set out in the relevant Contribution Agreement or Third Party Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1423 ft23">On an exceptional basis specific payment modalities may be defined in the relevant Contribution Agreement or Third Party Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1424 ft323">Each Contributor shall transfer the payable Contributions or Third Party Financing directly to the Account or the bank account indicated by the Bank in the relevant Third Party Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1355 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.2.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft335">Allocation, administration and management of Contributions Paid</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1425 ft23">Each Contributor hereby authorises and appoints the Bank to act as the Administrator of the Platform to:</P>
<P class="p1426 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">provide the services described in these Platform Rules and in particular, the allocation (in accordance with Article 5.2 of these Platform Rules) of the Contributions Paid, the administration and the management of the Resources;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1427 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">credit the Resources to the relevant Fund Account; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1427 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">debit from the relevant Fund Account any amount (i) to be disbursed for the purpose of</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1428 ft161">the activities of the Platform, (ii) due to the EIB in accordance with the Legal Framework (in particular, Article 7 of these Platform Rules), (iii) repaid to any Contributor,</P>
<P class="p1429 ft23"><SPAN class="ft164">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft263">corresponding to any fees, losses, and costs arising out of the treasury management (including, but not limited to, fees, losses, and costs charged by the Unitary Fund), and (v) corresponding to any applicable charge.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1430 ft244">57</P>

</DIV>

<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1431 ft23">The Bank shall ensure that the Contributions Paid are allocated, and the Resources administered and managed with the same diligence as the Bank's own resources and operations and in accordance with the Legal Framework<SPAN class="ft183">12</SPAN>. In particular, the Bank shall promptly upon receipt of the Contributions on the Account, allocate the Contributions to a specific Fund in accordance with the terms of the Contribution Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">The Contributions Paid shall, for and in relation to each Fund, be kept in separately and segregated from any and all of the Bank's own resources and from any other Contributions Paid allocated to another Fund or other assets held by the Bank in any capacity. Any cash held on the Account is held at the risk of the Contributors.</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">Each Contributor acknowledges and agrees that the Contributions may be allocated by the Bank on a <NOBR>non-refundable</NOBR> basis, depending on the Instrument used to carry out the operations of an individual Fund, and that a part or all of their Contribution may not be repaid to them. Each Contributor acknowledges and agrees that it is its intention to invest in such Instruments and the Bank shall not be held liable towards the Contributors for the repayment of the Contributions should all or part of these Contributions be invested on a <NOBR>non-refundable</NOBR> basis and each Contributor agrees to hold the Bank harmless in such a situation.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">The Bank shall report on its administration and management of the Resources to the Contributors in accordance with the provisions of Article 9 of these Platform Rules and with the Legal Framework.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.2.5</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Change in status of Contributor</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1432 ft23">If a Contributor changes its status (for example by ceasing to be a Member State of the European Union or an EFTA Country) with the result that, after having become a Contributor, it ceases to fall within the definition of "Contributor" set out in Article 1, it shall nonetheless remain a Contributor with the full rights and privileges of a Contributor. It shall not be a Third Party for the purposes of the Legal Framework and its Contributions shall not be Third Party Financing. This provision shall apply in respect of all Contributions to all Funds under the Platform, whether the applicable Contribution Agreement was signed before or after the change in status of the Contributor.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Resources under management</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Each Contributor acknowledges and agrees that: (i) any investment carried out by the Bank, including any investment in the Unitary Fund, is subject to fees, losses and costs, which are to be borne by the Resources, and (ii) the amounts available for financing operations through the Funds under the Platform may be lower than the Resources.</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">The Resources shall be managed in accordance with the principles of sound financial management and shall be invested in accordance with Article 8 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">3.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Transfer of Resources</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1434 ft161">A Fund Outstanding Balance may be partially or fully transferred from one Fund to (an)other Fund(s), and to (an)other Instrument(s), provided that the EIB and the respective</P>
<P class="p1391 ft274"><SPAN class="ft241">12</SPAN><SPAN class="ft329">For more details refer to Article 12 of these Platform Rules.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1384 ft321">ARTICLE 4</P>
<P class="p1436 ft321">FUNDS, ELIGIBLE OPERATIONS AND INSTRUMENTS UNDER THE PLATFORM</P>
<P class="p1380 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">4.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Creation of a Fund</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">The Bank may establish a new Fund under the Platform at its discretion and may take such a decision on the basis of, among others, the needs and requests of existing or potential Contributors. Each Fund shall be established in accordance with these Platform Rules and any specific rules set out in the relevant Fund Description, as applicable and agreed between the Bank and the relevant Contributor(s).</P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">For each Fund created, the Bank shall open a Fund Account and shall operate the respective Contributions Paid in accordance with Article 3.2.4 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">4.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Operations under the Funds</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The operations supported through the Contributions made to the Funds under the Platform shall be selected and administered in accordance with the EIB’s mandate and the objectives in all countries where EIB is operational. The Bank shall originate, identify, and structure operations, based on demand from eligible project promoters, in accordance with the eligibility criteria defined in the Fund Description.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Such operations can cover a broad geographic and sectorial scope and various types of assistance Instruments, of which a selection shall be made for each Fund.</P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">In relation to each Fund under the Platform the eligible regions, countries, sectors, beneficiaries and Instruments shall be specified in the Fund Description.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">4.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Geographical Coverage</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1438 ft323">All countries in which the EIB is mandated to operate in are eligible for financial support from Contributions made to the Funds under the Platform, both within and outside of the EU<SPAN class="ft336">13</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1439 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">4.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Eligible Sectors</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1440 ft161">Legal activities in all economic sectors are eligible for financial support from Funds under the Platform, with the exclusion of activities with a negative social or environmental impact, not addressed by mitigation plans approved by the competent authorities and</P>
<P class="p1441 ft274"><SPAN class="ft253">13 </SPAN>The information about eligible countries is available on the EIB Website: <SPAN class="ft330">http://www.eib.europa.eu/projects/regions/index.htm</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1442 ft244">59</P>

<P class="p1443 ft161">specifically excluded from EIB lending, as per the EIB internal procedures<SPAN class="ft326">14</SPAN>. Sector coverage shall duly take into consideration the relevant EU regional and country strategies.</P>
<P class="p1393 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">4.5</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Beneficiaries</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1444 ft23">Typical beneficiaries of the funding provided under the Platform shall be both public and private sector entities such as:</P>
<P class="p1374 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">states and other public sector entities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1445 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft233">public enterprises managed in accordance with market principles;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1446 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">financial intermediaries such as commercial banks, financial institutions, private equity funds and </SPAN><NOBR>micro-finance</NOBR> institutions;</P>
<P class="p1447 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">local and/or foreign private enterprises (large enterprises, project finance vehicles, SMEs and </SPAN><NOBR>mid-caps);</NOBR> and</P>
<P class="p1448 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft194">non-governmental</SPAN></NOBR> organisations.</P>
<P class="p1390 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">4.6</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Instruments</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1449 ft161">The following Instruments may be deployed within the Funds under the Platform (the below list is not exhaustive and may be updated unilaterally by the Bank from time to time):</P>
<P class="p1450 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft337">Technical assistance: </SPAN>an instrument aimed at supporting preparation and implementation of investments through institutional capacity building and the financing of e.g. <NOBR>pre-feasibility</NOBR> and feasibility studies, design and tender documents, institutional and legal appraisals, environmental and social impact assessments, project management, as well as financing upstream studies, gender analysis or advisory services to beneficiaries.</P>
<P class="p1451 ft161"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft338">Investment grants</SPAN>: <NOBR>non-reimbursable</NOBR> contribution to finance tangible or intangible components of an infrastructure project or venture, in joint or parallel <NOBR>co-financing</NOBR> with financing from other investors. In particular, the investment grants may decrease the investment costs for a beneficiary through financing a part of the investment or through an increase of the concessionality of the financing package of a given project. They may also target specific project components which have substantial demonstrable social or environmental benefits or which can mitigate negative environmental or social impacts.</P>
<P class="p1452 ft161"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft339">Interest rate subsidies: </SPAN>the provision of a grant amount to an investor financing an operation to enable it to make <NOBR>long-term</NOBR> finance available in flexible ways that reduce the total amount of debt service to be paid by the borrower. Such subsidies can therefore be applied upfront or over time. In either case, such grants should aim to minimise market distortions. Financing operations benefiting from interest rate subsidies shall be in line with the EU position on debt sustainability in low income countries, where applicable.</P>
<P class="p1453 ft274"><SPAN class="ft253">14 </SPAN>The list of "Excluded Activities" is available on the EIB Website: <SPAN class="ft330">http://www.eib.org/about/documents/excluded‐activities‐2013.htm</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1456 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft341">Direct exchange: </SPAN>focused on strengthening the capacity of public and private sector organisations and groups via secondments, internships, and other activities which increase their knowledge, skill level and/or efficiency.</P>
<P class="p1384 ft321">ARTICLE 5</P>
<P class="p1457 ft321">GOVERNANCE OF THE PLATFORM</P>
<P class="p1458 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Governance structure</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1362 ft23">The Governance structure of the Platform shall consist of:</P>
<P class="p1459 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">the Administrator;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p12 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">Partnerships Committees at Platform level; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p12 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">Contributors’ Committee at Fund level.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1387 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Administrator</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Administrator shall receive Contributions Paid and manage the respective Resources (including the management of the Fund Outstanding Balance), in accordance with the Legal Framework and the Bank’s policies and procedures applicable to the administration of the assets stemming from the Contributions Paid.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Administrator is responsible for ensuring that operations supported under each Fund under the Platform are compliant with the Fund Description for that Fund and with these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1382 ft23">Roles and responsibilities of the Administrator include the following:</P>
<P class="p1460 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft285">administering Eligible Operations, including entering into agreements with beneficiaries, where appropriate;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1461 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">preparing documents for the Bank’s Governing Bodies’ approval;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1460 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft332">organizing meetings of each Contributors’ Committee and of the Partnerships Committees;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1462 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">preparing and circulating minutes of meetings of the Contributors and Partnerships Committees;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1461 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">handling written procedures in accordance with Article 5.8 of these Platform Rules;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1463 ft23"><SPAN class="ft164">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft332">compiling progress reports of operations and financial statements for distribution to each Contributors’ Committee; preparing the Platform’s annual Contributors’ report and other relevant documents necessary to allow the Partnerships Committee and each Contributors’ Committee to carry out their respective duties;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1464 ft244">61</P>

<P class="p1465 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(vii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">informing each Contributors’ Committee about operations and activities financed from Third Party Financing;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1466 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(viii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">providing guidance on the functioning of Platform and the underlying Fund processes and requirements;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1466 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(ix)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">preparing proposed amendments to the Fund Description of a specific Fund for decision by the Contributors’ Committee;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1467 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(x)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">proposing amendments to the provisions of the Platform Rules, in consultation with Contributors, where appropriate;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1468 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(xi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft220">supporting each Contributors’ Committee in commissioning reviews and evaluations;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1469 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(xii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">ensuring that, in communicating internally and externally, in its publications, in communication with beneficiaries, countries and other entities as well as the media, appropriate visibility is given to the Platform and its Contributors;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1469 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(xiii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">carrying out such other functions as may be necessary for the efficient administration of the Platform and the Funds created thereunder, except for functions which pertain to the competence of the relevant Contributors’ Committee and which have not been delegated to the Bank; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1466 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(xiv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft342">liaising and coordinating, to the extent necessary to fulfil its role, with Contributors and other relevant parties.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">The Bank, as Administrator, operates in accordance with applicable EIB policies and procedures. It is accountable to the Contributors’ Committees for the performance of its obligations in accordance with Article 12 of these Platform Rules, and is serving as the liaison between the Contributors’ Committees and the respective departments at the Bank. In this respect, the Administrator handles Funds’ operations in accordance with the EIB’s Access to</P>
<P class="p1470 ft23">Information Policy available on the website of the Bank <SPAN class="ft316">http://www.eib.org/attachments/strategies/pai_ips_en.pdf</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Partnerships Committees</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Contributors to the Funds shall be invited to meetings of the Partnerships Committees as organised from time to time at the Platform level for thematic and geographical windows, to discuss and provide strategic guidance to the EIB, advise on the operation of the Platform and on the opportunity to create new Funds.</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">The Partnerships Committee is solely an advisory body with no decision making power in relation to either the Platform or any Fund under the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Contributors’ Committees</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1394 ft323">For each Fund under the Platform a Contributors’ Committee shall be set up. The main role of each Contributors’ Committee is to oversee activities under the respective Fund and to approve specific operations supported through the Contributions made to such Fund. Decisions of each</P>

<P class="p1382 ft23">The roles and responsibilities of the Contributors’ Committee include the following:</P>
<P class="p1473 ft26"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft343">approving proposed operations within 15 Business Days of their receipt on a tacit basis, as applicable in accordance with Article 5.8 of these Platform Rules;</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1476 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft230">approving any amendment to the Fund Description, including any prolongation of the Fund;</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1479 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.5</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Members of the Partnerships Committees and the Contributors’ Committees</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">Each Contributor to a Fund is entitled to designate a member that shall represent such Contributor in the Partnerships Committee and the Contributors Committees. The Bank shall also be represented in the Partnerships Committee and in each of the Contributors’ Committees. Unless otherwise decided by the Bank and the Contributors Committees, Third Party Financing pursuant to Article 3.1 of these Platform Rules does not entitle the respective Third Parties to be represented in the Partnerships Committees and the relevant Contributors’ Committee and to attend their meetings.</P>
<P class="p1480 ft161">Contributors shall each appoint a member and an alternate member (the later only participating in a meeting in the case of absence of the member) and communicate in writing their names and contact details to the Bank within 30 Business Days following the execution of the Contribution Agreement. Each Contributor shall inform the Bank about a replacement of a member or an alternate within 30 Business Days of their appointment. Both the member and the alternate shall be authorised to exercise the Contributor’s rights in the Partnerships Committees and in each of the Contributors’ Committees. The member or the alternate, in the absence of the member, may be accompanied by no more than one advisory staff.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">An individual may at the same time serve as a member or an alternate of more than one Contributor in the Partnerships Committees and/or each relevant Contributors’ Committee subject to the <NOBR>non-objection</NOBR> of the Bank.</P>
<P class="p1382 ft23">No voting rights shall be granted to other persons than the designated members and alternates.</P>

<P class="p1481 ft23">and the Contributors’ Committees shall not be limited.</P>
<P class="p1418 ft323">If the European Commission becomes a Contributor to any of the Funds under the Platform, it shall be treated, for the purposes of these Platform Rules, as any other Contributor.</P>
<P class="p1482 ft161">Each Partnerships Committee and each Contributors’ Committee shall have a chairperson appointed by the EIB within 15 Business Days prior to the first scheduled meeting of such Partnerships Committee and each Contributors’ Committee or prior to the submission of first proposals for decision by the tacit procedure, as applicable. Such an appointment shall be communicated by the EIB to all the Contributors. A chairperson may be replaced by the EIB at its sole discretion at any time. The chairperson may invite representatives of governments, other institutions and entities to attend specific agenda items of meetings of the Partnerships Committees or the Contributors’ Committees as observers.</P>
<P class="p1483 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.6</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Meetings and conferences</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Meetings of the Partnerships Committees and the Contributors’ Committees that may take place from time to time shall be organised in the Bank’s headquarters in Luxembourg, or in such other place as may be indicated by the Bank.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">It is foreseen that an annual conference shall be organised once per annum, open for all Contributors and aimed at promoting the activities under the Funds and creating an opportunity for <NOBR>fund-raising.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">Concurrently with such an annual conference, the Partnerships Committees shall meet within thematic and geographical windows, with the aim to discussing and advising on strategic issues, overall orientations and priorities. Contributors Committees shall meet on a needs be basis either physically or via video conference.</P>
<P class="p1483 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.7</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Convening power</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">The chairperson of each Contributors’ Committee may convene meetings at any time at his own initiative or if so decided in a previous meeting of the Contributors’ Committee, or at the request of the Contributors to the relevant Fund, whose Contributions Paid account for not less than <NOBR>one-third</NOBR> of the aggregate amount of all Contributions Paid in the relevant Fund. The Contributors’ Committees may conduct business electronically via email or with the use of other devices or services that may be indicated by the Bank and made available to the Contributors.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.8</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft257">Decision-making</SPAN></NOBR> process</P>
<P class="p1484 ft23">Unless otherwise agreed in the Fund Description, decisions of the Contributors’ Committees are made as follows:</P>
<P class="p1398 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">during meetings, audio- or video conference meetings. Decisions taken during meetings are deemed binding if adopted by consensus. If no consensus can be reached, decisions can only be approved by Contributors representing at least:</SPAN></P>

<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1485 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">2/3 of the total amount of the Contributions Paid actually received by the Bank since the inception of the Fund from the Contributors present or represented at such a meeting; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1486 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft171">one-half</SPAN></NOBR> plus one of the total number of Contributors to the Fund;</P>
<P class="p1382 ft23">or</P>
<P class="p1487 ft161"><SPAN class="ft23">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft344">in writing, through a tacit procedure where the Contributors shall be given 15 Business Days to vote following the receipt of the draft decision and the corresponding documents. Written procedure requests may be submitted, with corresponding documentation, at any time. Such requests are deemed approved unless Contributors representing more than 1/3 of the total amount of the Contributions Paid to the Fund reject the proposed decision. The Chairperson shall inform the members and alternates of each Contributors’ Committees of the respective outcome of the written procedure at the next meeting of the Contributors’ Committee and in cases where no meeting is foreseen to take place within 90 Business Days following the adoption of the decision, the Bank shall inform the Contributors in writing within 30 Business Days following the adoption of the decision. Rejected decision by way of written procedure shall be discussed at the next meeting of the Contributors’ Committee. In exceptional circumstances, the 15 Business Days period for tacit approval may be shortened by the chairperson in duly justified cases but in any case shall not be shorter than 5 Business Days.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">In relation to each Fund, Contributors representing not less than (i) <NOBR>one-half</NOBR> plus one, of the Contributors who have entered into a Contribution Agreement with the Bank relating to that Fund and (ii) <NOBR>one-half</NOBR> plus 1% of the aggregate amount of all Contributions Paid in relation to that Fund since its inception, shall constitute a quorum at meetings of the relevant Contributors’ Committee.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Representatives and alternates shall notify the Bank in writing of any comments or requests for further information and of any potential conflict of interest with regard to one or more points on the agenda, at least 5 Business Days before the date of the meeting. They shall withdraw from the voting on the items in case of which the potential conflict of interest has been identified.</P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">If a Contributor identifies that it has a potential conflict of interest in relation to a request for a decision to be taken by written procedure, it shall inform the chairperson of that potential conflict of interest. The chairperson shall decide whether or not the Contributor in question shall be permitted to vote on the written procedure and may decide that the decision must be submitted to a meeting of Contributors.</P>
<P class="p1439 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">5.9</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Agenda and documentation</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1440 ft323">Prior to any meeting of the Contributors’ Committee, the Administrator shall prepare an agenda and relevant documentation and provide them to each Contributor’s designated member and alternate in electronic form 15 Business Days prior to the meeting.</P>
<P class="p1488 ft159">5.10 Minutes and disclosures</P>

<P class="p1482 ft161">Issues discussed during the Contributors’ Committee meeting and decisions made shall be recorded in the minutes of the meeting prepared by the Administrator. Draft minutes are circulated by the Administrator within 30 Business Days after the meeting to each member and alternate, for approval and/or comments, if any. Should amendments be requested by Contributors, the Administrator shall prepare and distribute final minutes for approval within 15 Business Days to all members and alternates of the Contributors’ Committee.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">In case of disagreements that cannot be resolved, the proposed amendment to the minutes shall be annexed to the minutes. The minutes shall, as a minimum, state the time and venue of the meeting, as well as the participants, the proceedings and the decisions adopted. If a decision is not unanimous, it shall be stated who voted for and who voted against. Minutes shall be signed by the Chairman. Minutes, shall, unless the contrary is proved, be conclusive evidence of the proceedings at a meeting.</P>
<P class="p1483 ft159">5.11 Correspondence</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Correspondence concerning the meetings shall be addressed to the Administrator. All notices, correspondence or documents to be transmitted pursuant to these Platform Rules may be transmitted using electronic mail or delivered via standard mail.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159">5.12 Confidentiality</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">Any persons attending Partnerships or Contributors’ Committees’ meetings shall be required to observe the confidentiality of the Committees’ work and deliberations. They shall not divulge any confidential information coming to their knowledge during the performance of their duties to persons outside the Bank or the Partnerships or Contributors’ Committees other than to persons assisting them in the performance of their duties, provided that such persons are subject to the equivalent duty of confidentiality. Documents relating to such work and deliberations shall be for the use of those to whom they are addressed, who shall be responsible for their safekeeping and the preservation of their confidentiality.</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">The minutes of meetings of Contributors, and decisions taken by written procedure, shall be considered confidential; however, the Bank or the chairperson of any Contributors’ Committee may publish or disclose decisions taken by the Contributors.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159">5.13 Remuneration</P>
<P class="p1394 ft23">Contributors do not receive remuneration and shall cover their own costs of participation unless otherwise decided in relation to any Fund by the Contributors of that Fund.</P>
<P class="p1490 ft321">ARTICLE 6</P>
<P class="p1491 ft321">APPROVAL PROCESS OF OPERATIONS</P>
<P class="p1391 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">6.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Design and implementation of operations</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1434 ft323">In order to ensure the quality of operations, the Bank shall make available Bank’s staff that will provide project expertise and high professional capacity and carry out the processes</P>
<P class="p1492 ft244">66</P>

<P class="p1355 ft23">necessary to establish, implement and administer the operations efficiently.</P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">The Bank shall ensure that projects submitted for financing are technically, economically and financially viable. All projects undergo an <NOBR>ex-ante</NOBR> due diligence performed by sector experts and are monitored on a regular basis according to the Bank’s monitoring procedures and guidelines.</P>
<P class="p1480 ft161">Implementation is embedded into the different Bank departments, and the EIB staff includes, among others, loan officers, financial monitoring officers, sector specialists in charge of the design and monitoring of the technical substance of the project as well as providing oversight of climate, social and environmental considerations including gender equality, procurement, legal, financial and other issues as deemed necessary. The EIB external/local offices are also involved in all steps of the operation cycle as necessary. In addition, corporate secretariat officers shall ensure the efficient <NOBR>decision-making</NOBR> process for operational and other documents submitted to the Partnerships Committees and the Contributors Committees.</P>
<P class="p1380 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">6.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Submission of operations for approval</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1493 ft23">No operation may be submitted to the Contributors of any Fund for approval unless it has first been approved by the Governing Bodies of the Bank.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Operations cannot be presented for approval in relation to a specific Fund if the total of all Contributions Paid in respect of that Fund (including Third Party Financing, as applicable) is lower than the amount necessary to finance the operation, after deduction of actual disbursements, existing commitments and administrative fees.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">6.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Operations below a defined threshold</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Unless otherwise agreed in the Fund Description, for operations financed from a Fund up to a certain threshold to be defined for each Fund in the relevant Fund Description, the Contributors’ Committee fully delegates the authority for approving the allocation of Contributions Paid to the Bank’s Governing Bodies. The Bank’s Governing Bodies’ decision on the allocation of Contributions Paid shall be guided by the eligibility criteria set out in the Fund Description.</P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">Operations approved by the Bank’s Governing Bodies shall be communicated, for information, to each member and alternate of the Contributors’ Committee within 15 Business Days following the Bank’s Governing Bodies’ approval.</P>
<P class="p1380 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">6.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Operations above a defined threshold</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Unless otherwise agreed in the Fund Description, for operations above the threshold defined for each Fund, in addition to and subsequently to the Bank’s Governing Bodies’ approval, the Contributors’ Committee shall be responsible for approving the allocation of Contributions Paid, in accordance with the <NOBR>decision-making</NOBR> process described in Article 5.8 of these Platform Rules.</P>

<P class="p1433 ft23">Eligible Operations shall be placed on the list of the Eligible Operations managed by the Administrator.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">An approval of an operation remains valid for 24 months. If the relevant operation has not been signed by that time, the approval shall lapse unless prolonged for one or more additional periods of up to 12 months (provided that the effect of the extensions does not prolong the authorisation to more than four years from the date of the Bank’s Governing Bodies’ approval of the operation) by either (i) the Bank alone if the total amount of the considered operation does not exceed the threshold referred to in Article 6.3 of these Platform Rules or (ii) the Bank together with the Contributors’ Committee (using the <NOBR>non-objection</NOBR> procedure) if the total amount of the considered operation exceeds the threshold referred to in Article 6.4 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1495 ft321">ARTICLE 7</P>
<P class="p1496 ft321">FEES</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">The Bank shall apply a fee structured to cover both: (i) costs incurred in administering the Platform and all the Funds under the Platform; and (ii) costs associated with implementing different types of Instruments under the Funds. The amount of fees owed to the Bank shall be deducted directly from the Fund Account.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">Unless otherwise agreed in the Fund Description, the fees charged to Contributors shall be the following:</P>
<P class="p1483 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">7.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Administration fee</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1391 ft23">Administration fee shall be calculated as follows:</P>
<P class="p1497 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">1 percent on the total committed Contribution, to be deducted by the Bank from the first instalment of such total committed Contribution; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1450 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">0.25 percent per annum, calculated at the Platform level</SPAN><SPAN class="ft183">15 </SPAN>on the outstanding available funds as at 31 December of the relevant year, to be deducted by the Bank within one month after the end of the financial year. The amount of the management fees charged with respect to the management of any pooled investment portfolio or any other investment product directly managed by the EIB (such as the Unitary Fund) shall be deducted from the fee computed under this section.</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">The Administration fee covers activities carried out to raise or access Contributors’ funds, account for the use of funds (audits, evaluations), management of Fund Outstanding Balances (such as costs arising from cash accounts, calculation agents, custody fees), communication and Contributor visibility, creation and maintenance of dedicated IT systems, Contributors engagement and all other costs to meet obligations placed on the Bank by Contributors.</P>
<P class="p1498 ft274"><SPAN class="ft241">15</SPAN><SPAN class="ft329">For the avoidance of doubt, “calculated at the Platform level” means that the fee of 0.25% shall be calculated on the Fund Outstanding Balance for each Fund as at 31 December of the relevant year and deducted from the cumulative Contributions paid in by each Contributor to each Fund.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1459 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">Investment grants and interest rate subsidies: 1 percent;</SPAN></P>
