<P class="p1480 ft161">Instrument fee covers the costs of the activity of multiple teams across the Bank contributing to various stages of the instrument management cycle, including the design of operations, the operations approval process, procurement, implementation and monitoring of operations, results and financial reporting, and other operational costs.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">7.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Other fees</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">For any additional request by a Contributor beyond those specified in these Platform Rules or in the Fund Description, additional fees may be applied by the Bank to the requesting Contributor.</P>
<P class="p1384 ft321">ARTICLE 8</P>
<P class="p1501 ft321">MANAGEMENT OF OUTSTANDING BALANCE</P>
<P class="p1362 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">8.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Investment of Fund Outstanding Balance</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1438 ft323">Each Contributor authorises the Bank to invest, at its discretion and at the risk of that Contributor, the Fund Outstanding Balance <NOBR>(pro-rata</NOBR> its Contribution Paid) in accordance with:</P>
<P class="p1502 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">the Asset Management Guidelines of the EIB (Annex II </SPAN><SPAN class="ft169">“Asset Management Guidelines” </SPAN>to these Platform Rules), where the Platform Outstanding Balance is at least equal to 100,000,000 euros and an investment horizon of more than one year; or</P>
<P class="p1503 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft233">the Unitary Fund in case where the Platform Outstanding Balance is lower than 100,000,000 euros or the investment horizon is less than one year. The Deed Poll and the Information Memorandum of the Unitary Fund shall be submitted to each Contributor upon the Bank receiving the Contribution and, as the case may be, upon revision of these documents.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1480 ft161">The Bank shall be entitled to invest the Platform Outstanding Balance in the Unitary Fund in accordance with this Article 8.1, and to divest the investments in the Unitary Fund any time as necessary to implement an operation. For that purpose, each Contributor hereby authorises the Bank to sign and execute the relevant subscription and redemption forms on its behalf and to deduct any amount concerning subscriptions, and fees and costs charged by the Unitary Fund from the Platform Outstanding Balance.</P>

<P class="p1393 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">8.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Proceeds/losses from placement of Fund Outstanding Balance</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Such investments made from the Fund Outstanding Balance may lead to gains or losses and such gains or losses shall be borne by each Fund from which the associated investments were made.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">8.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Investment tools and features</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1417 ft23">The details of each investment tool and features available to the Bank in relation to Article 8.1 of these Platform Rules are set out in Annex II <SPAN class="ft169">“Asset Management Guidelines” </SPAN>to these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">8.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Liability arising from management of Fund Outstanding Balance</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">The Bank shall only be bound to use its best endeavours (“<SPAN class="ft334">obligation de moyens”) </SPAN>when carrying out its duties as manager of the Fund’s Outstanding Balance, which each Contributor expressly accepts. The Bank shall in any case only be liable towards the Contributor in case of gross negligence (<SPAN class="ft334">“faute lourde”</SPAN>) or wilful misconduct (<SPAN class="ft334">“faute dolosive”</SPAN>).</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">Each Contributor is solely responsible for the transactions made on its behalf by the Bank in accordance with Article 8.1 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">With regard to the assessment and evaluation of the possible performance and risks of an asset, the Bank’s liability is limited to gross negligence (<SPAN class="ft169">“faute lourde”</SPAN>); this shall also apply to secondary contractual obligations. The Bank is only liable for direct damages and under no circumstances for any consequential or special damages (such as, for example, any loss due to an unexecuted transaction, loss of profit, loss of data, damaged or unreadable data, damage to goodwill, damage to reputation or waste of management time), which are triggered or occur as a result of any of the Contributors entering into these Platform Rules or their termination or suspension.</P>
<P class="p1393 ft23">Each Contributor agrees that the Bank does not guarantee any specific results and/or profits.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">Moreover, the Bank shall not be liable for any losses in the value of the Fund Outstanding Balance resulting from market fluctuations, from changes in the exchange rates or from any other reason, for fluctuations in the yield, for temporary overexposure of the Fund Outstanding Balance in relation to limits fixed in the Asset Management Guidelines or Unitary Fund of the EIB (due to the volatility of the markets, of other consequences, of errors of judgement or losses of opportunity when selecting investments, or for loss of opportunity at the level of the Contributor).</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Each Contributor acknowledges and accepts that the Bank may not at all times, be aware of all investment opportunities available in the financial markets.</P>
<P class="p1418 ft323">The Bank shall not be held liable for any depreciation suffered by any of the Contributors as a direct or indirect consequence of a change in the investment strategy applicable in the Asset</P>

<P class="p1386 ft23">The Bank shall not be liable for the correctness of information received from third parties and on which it relies for the management of the Fund Outstanding Balance. Similarly, the Bank shall not be held liable for inaccurate financial information provided to the Contributors on the basis of information provided by third parties.</P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">The responsibility of examining the expediency of investments in relation to current tax, duty and currency legislation remains with the Contributors.</P>

<P class="p1506 ft321">ARTICLE 9</P>
<P class="p1507 ft321">ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING</P>
<P class="p1427 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Accounts</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1500 ft23">The Bank shall maintain its recordings in the relevant accounts of the Platform exclusively in euros.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Financial statements</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">The Bank shall prepare the annual audited and consolidated financial statements for the Platform in euros. The consolidated financial statements shall be drawn up on the basis of cash receipts and disbursements except for the investments of Fund Outstanding Balances which shall be reported on a fair value basis.</P>
<P class="p1382 ft23">The financial statements shall comprise:</P>
<P class="p1508 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">a consolidated statement of account movements of the Funds under the Platform; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1509 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft233">individual statements for each Fund including the breakdown of all movements with value dates and including an overview of the Fund Outstanding Balances and an overview of fees charged.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1382 ft23">The financial year of each Fund is the calendar year.</P>

<P class="p1510 ft23">Once they have been audited in accordance with Article 10 of these Platform Rules, the financial statements shall be approved, in line with financial statement approval procedures generally applied by EIB to third party mandates.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Valuation</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1391 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.3.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Currencies</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1417 ft23">Whenever it shall be necessary for purposes of preparation or presentation of financial statements to determine the value of any currency in terms of another currency, the valuation shall be made by the Bank, using the same principles as the Bank applies for its own resources operations.</P>
<P class="p1393 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.3.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Investment of Fund Outstanding Balance</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">Whenever it shall be necessary for purposes of preparation or presentation of financial statements to determine the fair value of investments of the Fund or the Platform Outstanding Balance in comparison to the cost of investments, the valuation shall be made by the Bank, using the same principles as the Bank applies for its own resources operations.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Reporting</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1391 ft23">The Bank shall provide each Contributor with the following reports:</P>
<P class="p1393 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.4.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft257">Reporting at the Fund level:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1511 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">annual operations progress reports: providing a status update on operations, summary of operational highlights and issues over the reporting period, results report on the Fund level and financial status;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1512 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft233">bi-annual</SPAN></NOBR> operations progress update: providing information on new operations approved, financial resources and disbursements status, and the project pipeline;</P>
<P class="p1513 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">operations completion reports: providing a </SPAN><NOBR>fully-fledged</NOBR> information on operation including results and financial aspects; and</P>
<P class="p1514 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">annual audited and consolidated financial statements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">Measurable results shall be reported against the Result Framework developed for each Fund, and shall be based on the existing result measurement tools used at the EIB<SPAN class="ft183">[1] </SPAN>(<SPAN class="ft316">http://www.eib.org/projects/cycle/monitoring/rem.htm</SPAN>). Such Results Framework, which may be revised by the Bank from time to time in consultation with the Contributors, shall be used for reporting and evaluation purposes.</P>
<P class="p1515 ft274"><SPAN class="ft241">[1]</SPAN><SPAN class="ft329">The Bank measures the results of its operations through the 3 PA and ReM frameworks (inside and outside the EU respectively) and the logical framework covers both lending and technical assistance operations. These are based on a 3 pillar methodology, which is designed to show how EIB inputs (e.g. loan, technical advice) generate outputs (e.g. an electricity transmission line, a training programme), which enable outcomes (e.g. improved access to energy, improved institutional capacity) and, over time, lead to impact (e.g. development of economic infrastructure, regional integration).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1516 ft244">72</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">279</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_280">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1517 ft23">In addition, qualitative information shall be provided on important aspects of, among others, sustainability, ownership, broader economic impact, as frequent as appropriate.</P>
<P class="p1423 ft23">Limited additional reporting may be agreed with any Contributor to a Fund on a bilateral basis and may be subject to extra fees.</P>
<P class="p1382 ft159"><SPAN class="ft97">9.4.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft335">Reporting at the Platform level</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">The EIB shall issue a consolidated Annual Contributors Report that shall highlight activities and achievements across the Bank’s Funds portfolio, providing visibility to the Contributors and each of the Funds to which they contribute.</P>
<P class="p1480 ft161">In the context of review of the Platform activities (and for the first time in December 2022), the Bank shall provide the Contributors with an evaluation report analysing the impact of operations financed by the Funds under the Platform in the beneficiary countries.</P>
<P class="p1518 ft321">ARTICLE 10</P>
<P class="p1519 ft321">AUDIT AND CONTROL</P>
<P class="p1362 ft159">10.1 Audit</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The consolidated financial statements with respect to the Platform shall be subject to external auditing and the costs of such audit shall be borne by the Platform.</P>
<P class="p1440 ft161">The individual Fund Instrument account statements shall not be subject to external audit but shall be covered under the external audit of the Platform’s consolidated financial statements.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">10.2 Control</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Platform shall be managed in accordance with the Bank’s usual criteria and procedures, including appropriate control measures.</P>
<P class="p1518 ft321">ARTICLE 11</P>
<P class="p1520 ft321">DURATION</P>
<P class="p1362 ft159">11.1 Termination of a Fund and of the Platform</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Platform and the Funds under the Platform shall remain in force so long as there remain funds, commitments or investments with respect to the Platform and the Funds.</P>
<P class="p1362 ft23">Individual Funds shall not specify a termination date but may be terminated at any time by</P>
<P class="p1521 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">a</SPAN><SPAN class="ft345">decision of the relevant Fund’s Contributors’ Committee made with the unanimous consent of the Contributors and, if appropriate, after consultation of the EIB’s Governing Bodies.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1522 ft244">73</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">280</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_281">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p705 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1390 ft159">11.2 Payment of the Fund Outstanding Balance upon termination of a Fund</P>
<P class="p1523 ft23">Upon a decision of the relevant Contributors’ Committee, in view of the termination of a Fund, the following provisions shall apply with respect to the Fund Outstanding Balance of that Fund:</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft346">the Bank shall forthwith cease all activities relating to such corresponding amounts, except those incidental to the orderly realisation, conservation and preservation of such amounts and the settlement of the direct or contingent obligations to which they may be subject;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1523 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">in case where the Fund Outstanding Balance is positive, the Bank shall discuss with Contributors as to possible uses of the funds available from the Fund Outstanding Balance and not yet committed into an operation at the time of termination, with a view to integrate such funds in other Funds or as otherwise agreed with the Contributors. The remaining funds, if any, may as well be returned to the Contributors, if so requested in the decision on termination of the Fund;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1420 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">the Bank shall establish individual Fund Instrument account statements for the Fund being terminated for covering the period from the last annual consolidated financial statements till the date of termination, which shall be subject to the audit procedure referred to in Article 10 of these Platform Rules; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1433 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">in case where the Fund Outstanding Balance is equal to zero, the Bank may send to the Contributors an invoice corresponding to any remaining costs incurred, </SPAN><NOBR>pro-rata</NOBR> their respective Contributions Paid.</P>
<P class="p1524 ft321">ARTICLE 12</P>
<P class="p1525 ft321">STANDARD OF CARE AND LIABILITY</P>
<P class="p1391 ft159">12.1 Standard of Care</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">The Bank shall, in accordance with its internal policies and procedures, take all appropriate measures to prevent corrupt, fraudulent, collusive, coercive and obstructive practices in connection with the use of the Funds’ proceeds, and include provisions in its agreements with beneficiaries to give full effect to the relevant Bank guidelines on tax fraud, tax evasion, tax avoidance, aggressive tax planning, money laundering and financing of terrorism.</P>
<P class="p1483 ft159">12.2 The Bank acting as for its own resources and operations</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">When acting as Administrator of the Platform, the Bank shall exercise the same degree of care and diligence as for its own resources and operations. Each Contributor acknowledges and agrees that the obligations of the Bank, as Administrator, are to be performed on a best endeavour basis only (<SPAN class="ft169">“obligation de moyens”</SPAN>).</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">The Bank shall administer the Platform as it deems appropriate, in all respects in accordance with these Platform Rules and its internal policies and procedures. The relevant policies and procedures are available on the website of the Bank.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">The Bank may adopt new internal procedures and policies as it deems appropriate, which shall be applicable to these Platform Rules to the extent compatible with them.</P>
<P class="p1526 ft244">74</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">281</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_282">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1404 ft159">12.3 The Bank acting in specific circumstances</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">In certain circumstances, the Bank may, with the relevant Contributors’ approval expressed in a form separately agreed upon by the Bank and the relevant Contributor, carry out operations, under an individual Fund, that present a level of risk that can normally not be undertaken and borne by the EIB with its own resources. Therefore, the internal policies and procedures of the Bank shall not apply to these operations.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">In these specific circumstances, the Bank shall implement ad hoc policies and procedures in accordance with the level of risk inherent to, and the nature of, the contemplated operations. Such ad hoc policies shall always be consistent with the relevant Bank’s guidelines on tax fraud, tax evasion, tax avoidance, aggressive tax planning, money laundering and financing of terrorism.</P>
<P class="p1480 ft161">The Bank shall communicate those ad hoc policies and procedures to the relevant Contributors to the extent practically possible before the holding of a Contributors’ Committee to decide on the contemplated operation, as the case may be and, if not practically possible, promptly after the decision to launch the contemplated operation has been made.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">12.4 Liability limited to gross negligence and wilful misconduct</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Unless otherwise provided for in these Platform Rules and or in the relevant Contribution Agreement, the Bank shall only be liable in the case of gross negligence (<SPAN class="ft169">“faute lourde”</SPAN>) or wilful misconduct (<SPAN class="ft169">“faute dolosive”</SPAN>).</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">12.5 Force majeure and disturbance of business</P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">The Bank shall not be liable for any losses caused by abnormal or unforeseeable circumstances, force majeure, riot, war or natural events or due to other occurrences which are beyond the control of the Bank (for instance, strike, <NOBR>lock-out,</NOBR> traffic <NOBR>hold-ups,</NOBR> administrative acts of domestic or foreign authorities or courts, as well as interruptions of telecommunications system or other similar events).</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">12.6 Delays</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Nothing in these Platform Rules shall require the Bank to take any action which, in the opinion of the Bank acting in good faith, is not possible or would be in contravention of any applicable law, regulation, market custom or practice.</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Bank shall not be liable for any delays in the performance of its obligations under these Platform Rules arising from compliance with duties flowing from applicable laws and regulations.</P>
<P class="p1404 ft159">12.7 Limited recourse</P>
<P class="p1440 ft323">Each Contributor acknowledges and accepts that it has only recourse to the Contributions Paid allocated to the relevant Fund, in accordance with the account statement to be established by the Bank in relation to each Fund and subject to the deduction of any applicable fees, costs,</P>
<P class="p1527 ft244">75</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">282</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_283">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p705 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1482 ft161">losses, and charges. Each Contributor expressly acknowledges and accepts that once all the Contributions Paid of the relevant Fund have been realised (that is, if upon termination of the relevant Fund, all the Contributions Paid, subject to the deduction of any applicable fees, costs, losses, and charges, have been redeemed on a pro rata basis), it is not entitled to take any further steps against the Bank to recover any further sums due (if any) and the right to receive any such sum shall be extinguished. Each Contributor accepts not to attach or otherwise seize the assets of the Fund, if at all possible.</P>
<P class="p1524 ft321">ARTICLE 13</P>
<P class="p1528 ft321">AMENDMENTS AND ORDER OF PRECEDENCE</P>
<P class="p1529 ft159">13.1 Amendments</P>
<P class="p1394 ft23">The Bank may, at any time and in consultation with Contributors, amend the provisions of these Platform Rules. The Bank shall inform the Contributors indicating the provisions it intends to modify or add as well as the content thereof. In proposing amendments to the provisions of the Platform Rules, the Bank shall assess the potential impact of those amendments on existing Funds and inform the Contributors thereof.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">The amendments shall be deemed approved by the Contributors if they have not addressed a written objection to the Bank within 15 Business Days of dispatch of the notification by the Bank regarding the amendments.</P>
<P class="p1418 ft161">If one or more Contributors object(s) to the amendments proposed, these Contributors are entitled to terminate the Contribution Agreement they entered into with the Bank with immediate effect within the timeframe set out above and to ask for the refund of the portion not invested into operations, if any, and subject to the deduction of any applicable fees, costs, losses, and charges, of their Contribution Paid if the amendments proposed by the Bank:</P>
<P class="p1530 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">prevent such Contributor to continue to participate to the Platform in compliance with the laws and regulations applicable to it;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1531 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">impose on the Contributors to increase the amount of their Contributions; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1531 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft261">substantially increase the costs of participation in the Platform.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">A Contributor willing to terminate the Contribution Agreement pursuant to the termination process described above shall give evidence to the Bank and the other Contributors in the Fund that it is affected by an event listed under items <NOBR>(i)-(iii)</NOBR> above.</P>
<P class="p1418 ft323">If an amendment to the provisions of the Platform Rules has a negative impact on one or more Funds, the relevant Contributors’ Committees shall decide whether to continue the affected Funds or to terminate them in accordance with Article 11.1 of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1482 ft161">Each Contributor acknowledges and agrees that technical amendments (such as, but not limited to, correction of drafting errors, numbering of Articles in the Platform Rules or cross- or external references in the Platform Rules) and amendments that do not affect the substance of any provisions of these Platform Rules may be made unilaterally by the Bank. The Bank shall immediately inform the Contributors of those technical or minor amendments.</P>
<P class="p1377 ft244">76</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">283</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_284">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1355 ft159">13.2 Order of precedence</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">In the event of any inconsistency or conflict between the terms of the Platform Rules, a Contribution Agreement and those of the corresponding Fund Description, the following order of priority shall apply:</P>
<P class="p1532 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">the Contribution Agreement (as between the Bank and the relevant Contributor);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1533 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft233">the Fund Description; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1534 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">the Platform Rules.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1440 ft161">In the event that there is more than one Contribution Agreement between the Bank and a Contributor in relation to the same Fund, then in the event of any inconsistency or conflict between the two, the later shall prevail as between the Bank and that Contributor.</P>
<P class="p1518 ft321">ARTICLE 14</P>
<P class="p1535 ft321">SEVERABILITY</P>
<P class="p1440 ft161">If, at any time, any of the provisions under these Platform Rules is or becomes illegal, invalid or unenforceable in any respect under the law of any jurisdiction, neither the legality, validity or enforceability of the remaining provisions of these Platform Rules nor of such provisions under the law of any other jurisdiction shall in any way be affected or impaired thereby.</P>
<P class="p1518 ft321">ARTICLE 15</P>
<P class="p1536 ft321">DISPUTE RESOLUTION AND GOVERNING LAW</P>
<P class="p1362 ft159">15.1 Amicable resolution of disputes</P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">The parties having agreed to these Platform Rules shall endeavour to settle amicably any dispute or complaint relating to the interpretation, application or fulfilment of these Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">15.2 Jurisdiction</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">For the purposes of any dispute arising in relation to these Platform Rules, the parties hereby submit to the jurisdiction of the Court of Justice of the European Union.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">15.3 Governing law</P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">These Platform Rules are governed by, and shall be construed in accordance with, the laws of the <NOBR>Grand-Duchy</NOBR> of Luxembourg.</P>
<P class="p1537 ft244">77</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">284</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_285">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p705 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p917 ft321">ANNEX I</P>
<P class="p1538 ft321">RECEIPT OF THIRD PARTY FINANCING</P>
<P class="p1433 ft247">With a view to reinforcing complementarities and coordination with other parties’ activities that are in line with the objectives and guiding principles of the Platform, (other countries, International Financial Institutions, funds, foundations, private and banking entities etc.) the Contributors’ Committee of a Fund may authorize Third Party Financing in relation to that Fund.</P>
<P class="p1418 ft347">Capitalised terms used in this Annex and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meaning given to such terms in the Platform Rules to which this Annex is attached.</P>
<P class="p1539 ft159">Article 1 Third Party Financing</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Third Parties may contribute funds to a Fund under the Platform subject to the approval by the Bank and to the unanimous approval by the Contributors’ Committee of the relevant Fund. Once approved as eligible resources for the relevant Fund, Third Party Financing is subject to the special terms and conditions set forth in this Annex.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">The approval of Third Party Financing does not result in the Third Party acquiring the status of Contributor and does not give the right to the Third Party concerned to be represented in the Contributors’ Committee of the relevant Fund and to participate in its meetings, written procedures or in any governance structure of the relevant Fund.</P>
<P class="p1420 ft23">The Bank shall act as an intermediary with respect to Third Party Financing. In this respect, Third Party Financing shall not be recognized as Contributions in the Fund’s financial statements.</P>
<P class="p1483 ft159">Article 2 Third Party Agreement</P>
<P class="p1433 ft23">Subject to the approval of the Bank’s Governing Bodies and the Contributors’ Committee of the relevant Fund, the Bank may sign, in its role of Administrator, an agreement with the relevant Third Party (the “Third Party Agreement”) specifying the name of the Third Party (including name of the contact person), nature of the Third Party Financing, applicable rules and its use. The use of the Third Party Financing shall be in line with the general purposes of the Platform and the related Fund, and for the operations approved as indicated in the Third Party Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1419 ft159">Article 3 Amount and Payment Modalities of Third Party Financing</P>
<P class="p1417 ft23">The Third Party Agreement shall in principle include the total amount and payment modalities of the Third Party Financing. When such elements are not included in the Third Party Agreement at the time of the signature, the Contributors’ Committee of the relevant Fund shall be separately informed about the precise amount and payment modalities of the Third Party Financing under the Third Party Agreement, as soon as practically possible. Funds shall be committed exclusively in euros.</P>
<P class="p1540 ft244">78</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">285</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_286">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1404 ft159">Article 4 Rules Applicable to Third Party Financing</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Proposals for potential operations funded from the Third Party Financing shall be submitted for approval to the Bank’s Governing Bodies and the Contributors’ Committee of the relevant Fund shall be informed about the approved operations.</P>
<P class="p1437 ft23">The Third Party Financing shall be governed by the terms and conditions specified in the Third Party Agreement, including the use of such funds, reporting obligations, payment modalities, visibility, dispute settlement.</P>
<P class="p1362 ft23">Article 12 of the Platform Rules shall apply with respect to Third Party Financing.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">Article 5 Bank Account for Third Party Financing</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Bank shall open a separate account in its accounting books for each Fund under which Third Party Financing has been approved. This account shall be called “Fund [<SPAN class="ft188"></SPAN>] – Financing from Third Party” for the receipt of the Third Party Financing, the disbursement of the monies and the Bank’s fees, and any potential remuneration as indicated in the Third Party Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1382 ft23">Article 7 of the Platform Rules shall apply with respect to Third Party Financing.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">Article 6 Financial Reporting</P>
<P class="p1388 ft23">The Bank shall provide financial reporting to substantiate the use of the Third Party Financing in accordance with the Article 9 of the Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">Article 7 Audit</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">Movements from the separate account opened for Third Party Financing may be subject to a separate external audit in accordance with the provisions of the Article 10 of the Platform Rules.</P>
<P class="p1387 ft159">Article 8 General Reporting Obligations</P>
<P class="p1386 ft23">The Bank shall ensure that the Contributors’ Committee of the relevant Fund is comprehensively informed on an annual basis with respect to all operations and activities financed from Third Party Financing.</P>
<P class="p1541 ft244">79</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">286</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_287">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p705 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1542 ft321">ANNEX II</P>
<P class="p1543 ft321">ASSET MANAGEMENT GUIDELINES</P>
<P class="p1391 ft159">Preamble</P>
<P class="p1394 ft161">The assets constituting the Platform Outstanding Balance from time to time which are under treasury management by the EIB (the “<SPAN class="ft162">Platform’s Assets</SPAN>”) shall be managed in accordance with the principles of sound financial management and following appropriate prudential rules in accordance with the principles laid down in Section I below. These assets shall be invested at the risk of the Contributors according to the guidelines as set out in Section II below. In this document, “Unitary Fund” means the pooled investment portfolio established by the EIB by the Deed Poll of 1 July 2009 as supplemented and amended from time to time and as defined in the corresponding Information Memorandum.</P>
<P class="p1483 ft177">Section I - Principles Relating to the Platform Outstanding Balance</P>
<P class="p1391 ft23"><SPAN class="ft97">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft348">The EIB shall manage Platform’s Assets in accordance with the following principles:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1544 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">The risk exposure taken on the Platform’s Assets shall be limited to the capital invested and returns earned thereon.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1545 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">While executing transactions on behalf of the Platform, the EIB shall apply the same standards of due diligence and care it normally applies when managing its own treasury portfolios or its other mandates. While purchasing securities at any time, either on the primary market or the secondary market, the EIB shall guarantee equal treatment among the different portfolios under management. In this context, it shall not purchase securities of the same issue at the same time on more advantageous conditions for its own account or for the account of any other portfolio under management.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1546 ft161"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft349">Management of the assets shall be based on the best practice of the asset management industry and on the traditional prudential rules applied in financial activities. Management shall comply with the risk limitations set out under these Asset Management Guidelines. Particular care shall need to be taken to ensure that the managed assets provide sufficient liquidity in relation to the commitments to which the assets must respond, while still optimizing the return that is compatible with maintaining a </SPAN><NOBR>high-degree</NOBR> of security and stability over <NOBR>long-term.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p1545 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft230">The EIB shall not be authorized to enter into speculative transactions or to borrow from the market to cover any liquidity gap. Unforeseen cash payments that are not sufficiently covered by cash holdings shall be covered adequately by the sale of assets. Reverse repo and collateralised securities lending transactions are authorised at the discretion of the EIB subject to the limitations set out in these Asset Management Guidelines.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1547 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">A performance index, taken as a benchmark shall be defined by the EIB and shall be in line with the existing benchmark used for other </SPAN><NOBR>third-party</NOBR> portfolios.</P>
<P class="p1393 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft194">All investments need to respect the limits set out hereto.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1393 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(vii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">In accordance with the operational cash flow forecast, the EIB shall take the necessary</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1421 ft244">80</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">287</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_288">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1401 ft23">measures to manage the placement of the Platform’s Assets in order to execute all payments in a timely manner.</P>
<P class="p1548 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(viii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft171">Securities transactions shall be based on the principle of “delivery versus payment”; delivery and payment to clearing systems are authorized.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1549 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(ix)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft230">The sale of assets is authorized, among others, if the securities no longer correspond to the criteria set out hereto or with a view to balancing the maturity profile or enhancing overall portfolio performance.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1362 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(x)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">The EIB shall regularly supervise the continuous respect of the limits set out hereto.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1548 ft23"><SPAN class="ft97">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">Funds’ Assets may be invested in EUR. Hedging instruments may be considered if relevant and </SPAN><NOBR>cost-efficient.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p1387 ft177">Section II: Guidelines</P>
<P class="p1500 ft23">The EIB shall manage the Funds’ Assets in accordance with the principles set out in Section I above.</P>
<P class="p1382 ft238"><SPAN class="ft350">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft351">Portfolio structure</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1440 ft23">The portfolio maturity structure shall reflect the projected cash flows from the Platform / Funds. Sufficient assets shall be placed in monetary assets to cover the short term (less than one year) outflows, at a proportion to be fixed in the annual investment strategy.</P>
<P class="p1549 ft23"><SPAN class="ft350">1.1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft171">The remaining assets may be allocated to medium and long term instruments, with a maximum remaining maturity of 10 years and six months from the payment date (medium and </SPAN><NOBR>long-term</NOBR> portfolio).</P>
<P class="p1549 ft23"><SPAN class="ft350">1.2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft171">Should the requirements of efficient portfolio management or some other grounded reasons require so and/or if the portfolio of asset management is smaller than EUR 100 million the EIB may allocate more or all of the assets in the units of the Unitary Fund. The EIB may in any case temporarily allocate more or all of the assets in the units of the Unitary Fund pending investment of the relevant part of the assets to the medium and long term instruments.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1362 ft238"><SPAN class="ft350">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft351">Types of investment</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1480 ft161">The monetary assets may comprise units in the Unitary Fund, and other short term instruments with maturities up to 397 days at value date including fixed rate bonds (with such remaining maturity) and floating rate notes of up to 2 years of remaining maturity. It is understood that the Unitary Fund shall constitute the preferred investment option for the monetary assets in EUR. In case of unsecured bank deposits, the time to maturity should not exceed 95 days at value date. Considering the portion of the monetary assets invested in unsecured bank deposits, due consideration should be given to prevailing market conditions and risks. The remaining assets may include fixed rate bonds with remaining maturity longer than 397 days and floating rate bonds with more than 2 years of remaining maturity.</P>

<P class="p1550 ft23">The rating criteria refer to Moody's "or equivalent". In case of split ratings, the second best rating is considered for assessing whether the rating criteria are met.</P>

<P class="p1553 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">3.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft357">Criteria for the Bank's Unitary Fund, </SPAN><NOBR>short-term</NOBR> money market funds, deposits, including collateralised deposits, reverse repos:</P>
<P class="p1545 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">3.1.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft332">The EIB Unitary Fund operating and managed in accordance with the Deed Poll and its information memorandum, shall be eligible. Up to 100% of the assets allocated to the monetary assets held in EUR may be invested in the EIB Unitary Fund. The concentration limits do not apply to the Unitary Fund.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1545 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">3.1.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft332">The banks authorised to receive term deposits shall be rated at least </SPAN><NOBR>P-1</NOBR> <NOBR>short-term</NOBR> Moody's or equivalent. <P class="p1557 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">3.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft357">Criteria for securities investments:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1558 ft23"><SPAN class="ft359">3.2.1</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft219">Short-term</SPAN></NOBR> securities (remaining term to maturity from acquisition settlement date: less than 397 days)</P>
<P class="p1559 ft23"><SPAN class="ft359">3.2.1.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">Purchases of </SPAN><NOBR>long-term</NOBR> and <NOBR>medium-term</NOBR> bonds with less than 397 days to run must comply with the conditions applicable to <NOBR>medium-term</NOBR> and <NOBR>long-term</NOBR> bonds described in 3.2.2 and respect the limits set out therein.</P>
<P class="p1558 ft23"><SPAN class="ft359">3.2.1.2</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">For </SPAN><NOBR>short-term</NOBR> securities, purchases are not authorised unless one of the following conditions is satisfied:</P>
<P class="p1560 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">•</SPAN><SPAN class="ft360">instruments (certificates, </SPAN><NOBR>T-bills</NOBR> etc.) are issued by states or institutions satisfying the definition set out in 3.2.2;</P>
<P class="p1561 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">•</SPAN><SPAN class="ft360">instruments are issued by authorised banks referred to in 3.1.3 and within the limits set out in 3.1.3;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1562 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">•</SPAN><SPAN class="ft360">instruments are issued by </SPAN><NOBR>non-credit</NOBR> institutions when the issuer or issuance program complies with the criteria set out in 3.1.3 and the eligibility criteria set out in 3.1.3 <SPAN class="ft169">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>

<P class="p553 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">3.3</SPAN><SPAN class="ft357">Applicable Rating</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1576 ft23">Securities should be rated at least by one of the rating agencies Standard and Poor's, Fitch or Moody's. In the absence of all bond/issue ratings, the respective issuer ratings (in case of guaranteed positions the guarantor ratings) shall be considered.</P>
<P class="p83 ft23">Loss of required rating</P>
<P class="p1576 ft23">In case of a loss of required rating, the EIB shall endeavor to replace the relevant assets in the portfolio by other assets of adequate quality respecting the relevant limits. Alternatively, the EIB may analyze, among other factors, the remaining maturity of the asset and the probability of repayment at scheduled maturity, and as a result of this analysis decide to keep such assets.</P>
<P class="p1576 ft23">Member State securities (including securities guaranteed by Member States) may be kept in an event of loss of required rating(s).</P>
<P class="p553 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">3.4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft357">Concentration limits</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1577 ft23"><SPAN class="ft356">3.4.1</SPAN><SPAN class="ft332">The total exposure to the same issuer or counterparty (consolidated at the TOP parent level) shall not exceed 10% (in the case of Member States, 20%) of the total amount of that portfolio.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p1581 ft236">Annex 2</P>
<P class="p1582 ft237">Terms and Conditions of the Liquidity Facility</P>
<P class="p1583 ft23">These Terms and Conditions shall form an integral part of the Contribution Agreement between each contributor (in these Terms and Conditions the <SPAN class="ft159">“Borrower”</SPAN>) and the European Investment Bank (in these Terms and Conditions the <SPAN class="ft159">“Lender”</SPAN>).</P>
<P class="p1107 ft23">IT IS AGREED as follows:</P>
<P class="p1584 ft159"><SPAN class="ft98">I.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft365">The Facility</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1104 ft23">The Borrower has requested the Lender to make available an uncollateralised credit facility (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Facility</SPAN>”), the proceeds of which shall be used for the purposes of payments under the first demand guarantee (the “<SPAN class="ft159">First Demand Guarantee</SPAN>”) entered into by the Borrower together with other guarantors in the context of the EU <NOBR>COVID-19</NOBR> Guarantee Fund (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Fund</SPAN>”).</P>
<P class="p1585 ft23">The Borrower has entered into a contribution agreement (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Contribution Agreement</SPAN>”) to make contributions (“<SPAN class="ft159">Contributions</SPAN>”) to the Fund. The Facility shall be used to make Advances to the Borrower in the event that a Demand under its First Demand Guarantee will not be funded by Upfront Payments or cash contributions to the Fund.</P>
<P class="p1586 ft26">Capitalised terms which are defined in the First Demand Guarantee and the Contribution Agreement shall unless otherwise defined bear the same meaning in these Terms and Conditions.</P>
<P class="p845 ft159"><SPAN class="ft98">II.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft365">Total amount of the Facility - Use of the proceeds</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1587 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">The total principal amount of the Facility for each Contributor shall be its Adjusted Key Percentage of EUR 7,500,000,000 (</SPAN><SPAN class="ft169">seven billion and five hundred million euro</SPAN>) (the resulting amount being the Contributor’s “<SPAN class="ft159">Facility Amount</SPAN>”). The aggregate total principal amount of all Facilities shall be equal to the aggregate of the Facility Amounts for all Contributors (the “<SPAN class="ft159">Aggregate Facilities Amount</SPAN>”).</P>
<P class="p1588 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">The Borrower agrees to use the proceeds of the Facility solely for the purposes of financing payments under the First Demand Guarantee.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1589 ft159"><SPAN class="ft98">III.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft365">Availability</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1590 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft366">The Facility will be available in one or more advances (each an “</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Advance</SPAN>” and together the “<SPAN class="ft97">Advances</SPAN>”) until the earlier of (i) the date on which the Fund is terminated in accordance with Article 11 of the Platform Rules and (ii) 30 April 2038 (the “<SPAN class="ft97">Availability Period</SPAN>”).</P>
<P class="p1591 ft160"><SPAN class="ft26">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft367">At any time prior to the expiry of the Availability Period if the credit balance on the Dedicated Register of the Borrower on any Business Day is insufficient to discharge in full the portion of a Demand to be paid by the Borrower then the Lender shall finance the Borrower's obligations in relation to such Demand or such amounts by making an Advance to the Borrower for the Advance Period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1592 ft23">“<SPAN class="ft159">Advance Period</SPAN>” means, in relation to an Advance, the period commencing on its utilisation date (its “<SPAN class="ft159">Advance Date</SPAN>”) and ending on the Advance Repayment Date.</P>
<P class="p1593 ft23"><SPAN class="ft159">“Advance Repayment Date” </SPAN>means a Payment Date under the Contribution Agreement after the Advance Date of the relevant Advance and means:</P>
<P class="p1594 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">for an Advance in relation to which the Advance Date falls between 31 December in year </SPAN><NOBR>n-1</NOBR> (inclusive) and 30 March in year n (inclusive), 15 June in year n;</P>
<P class="p1595 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft259">for an Advance in relation to which the Advance Date falls between 31 March in year n (inclusive) and 29 June in year n (inclusive), 15 September in year n;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1596 ft244">86</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">293</P>

</DIV>
<DIV id="page_294">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p235 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1597 ft26"><SPAN class="ft23">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft366">for an Advance in relation to which the Advance Date falls between 30 June in year n (inclusive) and 29 September in year n (inclusive), 15 December in year n; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1598 ft26"><SPAN class="ft23">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft366">for an Advance in relation to which the Advance Date falls between 30 September in year n (inclusive) and 30 December in year n (inclusive), 15 March in year n+1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1599 ft23">If an Advance Repayment Date would be a day that is not a TARGET2 Business Day, the Advance Repayment Date shall instead be the following day that is a TARGET2 Business Day.</P>
<P class="p1600 ft23">Borrower shall not repay an Advance prior to the applicable Advance Repayment Date except with the prior agreement of the Lender</P>
<P class="p1601 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft230">All amounts due hereunder must, if not repaid earlier pursuant to another provision of these Terms and Conditions, be repaid by 15 September 2038.</SPAN></P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t120">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td295"><P class="p3 ft159">IV.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td42"><P class="p3 ft97">Interest Rate</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1602 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft343">Interest on each Advance shall be payable on the Advance Repayment Date of such Advance at the rate of the EURIBOR for the Advance Period plus the aggregate of: (i) a spread (which may be positive or negative) calculated following the Lender's standard pricing methodology for recovering its cost of funding on the capital markets; and (ii) a </SPAN><NOBR>mark-up</NOBR> in respect of its administrative costs of five basis points (0.05%) per annum (the “<SPAN class="ft97">Applicable Rate</SPAN>”). If the Applicable Rate is a negative number, it shall be deemed to be zero.</P>
<P class="p1603 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft252">“</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">EURIBOR</SPAN>” means:</P>
<P class="p1604 ft23"><SPAN class="ft26">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft218">in respect of a relevant period of less than one month, the Screen Rate (as defined below) for a term of one month;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1605 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft368">in respect of a relevant period of one or more months for which a Screen Rate is available, the applicable Screen Rate for a term for the corresponding number of months; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1606 ft160"><SPAN class="ft26">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft369">in respect of a relevant period of more than one month for which a Screen Rate is not available, the rate resulting from a linear interpolation by reference to two Screen Rates, one of which is applicable for a period next shorter and the other for a period next longer than the length of the relevant period,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1607 ft159"><SPAN class="ft23">(the period for which the rate is taken or from which the rates are interpolated being the “</SPAN>Representative Period<SPAN class="ft23">”).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1608 ft23">For the purposes of paragraphs (ii) and (iii) above:</P>
<P class="p1609 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft170">“</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">available</SPAN>” means the rates, for given maturities, that are calculated and published by Global Rate Set Systems Ltd (GRSS), or such other service provider selected by the European Money Markets Institute (EMMI), or any successor to that function of EMMI, as determined by the Bank; and</P>
<P class="p1610 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft181">“</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Screen Rate</SPAN>” means the rate of interest for deposits in EUR for the relevant period as published at 11h00, Brussels time, or at a later time acceptable to the Bank on the day (the “<SPAN class="ft97">Reset Date</SPAN>”) which falls 2 (two) relevant Business Days prior to the first day of the relevant period, on Reuters page EURIBOR 01 or its successor page or, failing which, by any other means of publication chosen for this purpose by the Bank.</P>
<P class="p1611 ft23">All percentages resulting from any calculations referred to in this Clause will be rounded, if necessary, to the nearest one <NOBR>hundred-thousandth</NOBR> of a percentage point, with halves being rounded up.</P>
<P class="p1612 ft23">If EURIBOR is not published in respect of a day for which it is required, then the Bank shall replace it with another benchmark rate and make any appropriate adjustment to the spread, <NOBR>day-count</NOBR> fraction, quotation date(s) and/or calculation period which it will determine in good faith and in a commercially reasonable manner.</P>
<P class="p1613 ft244">87</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">294</P>

<DIV id="page_295">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p705 ft3">Prop. 2019/20:181</P>
<P class="p706 ft3">Bilaga 9</P>
<P class="p1614 ft26">If any of the provisions of this Clause become inconsistent with provisions adopted under the aegis of EMMI and EURIBOR ACI (or any successor to that function of EMMI and EURIBOR ACI as determined by the Lender) in respect of EURIBOR the Lender may by notice to the Borrower amend the provision to bring it into line with such other provisions.</P>
<P class="p1615 ft26">If the Screen rate becomes permanently unavailable, the Euribor replacement rate will be the rate (inclusive of any spreads or adjustments) formally recommended by (i) the working group on euro <NOBR>risk-free</NOBR> rates established by the European Central Bank (ECB), the Financial Services and Markets Authority (FSMA), the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) and the European Commission, or (ii) the European Money Market Institute, as the administrator of EURIBOR, or (iii) the competent authority responsible under Regulation (EU) 2016/1011 for supervising the European Money Market Institute, as the administrator of the EURIBOR, or (iv) the national competent authorities designated under Regulation (EU) 2016/1011, or (iv) the European Central Bank.</P>
<P class="p1616 ft26">If no Screen Rate and/or the Euribor replacement rate is available as provided above, EURIBOR shall be the rate (expressed as a percentage rate per annum) which is determined by the Bank to be the <NOBR>all-inclusive</NOBR> cost to the Bank for the funding of the relevant Advance or amount based upon the then applicable internally generated Bank reference rate or an alternative rate determination method reasonably determined by the Bank.</P>
<P class="p1617 ft23"><SPAN class="ft23">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft233">All interest shall be calculated on the basis of a 360 day year and actual days elapsed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1618 ft26"><SPAN class="ft26">D.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft370">If any amount under this Agreement is not paid on the date it is due then such unpaid amount shall bear interest at the daily rate of €STR plus a spread of two per cent (2%) per annum floored at zero calculated on a daily basis which interest shall accrue from the date when payment was due until the date of actual payment of such unpaid amount. For this purpose €STR means the euro </SPAN><NOBR>short-term</NOBR> rate administered by the European Central Bank (or any other person which takes over the administration of that rate) displayed (before any correction, recalculation or republication by the administrator) on page EUROSTR of the Thomson Reuters screen (or any replacement Thomson Reuters page which displays that rate)<SPAN class="ft23">.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1619 ft160"><SPAN class="ft160">E.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft371">For the avoidance of doubt, interest on each Advance shall be payable on the Advance Repayment Date</SPAN><SPAN class="ft164">. </SPAN>Interest accrued on each Advance shall not be debited from the Dedicated Register or financed through a new Advance but shall be paid in cleared cash on each Payment Date, except to the extent that it has been paid in accordance with the allocation rules and orders of priority of the Fund.</P>
<P class="p1620 ft159"><SPAN class="ft159">V.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft365">Illegality</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1621 ft23">The Lender may notify the Borrower if it believes it is or will be acting illegally in relation to these Terms and Conditions. The illegality may relate to the performance of the Lender’s obligations or the maintenance of these Terms and Conditions, the Facility and, or any or all of the Advances.</P>
<P class="p1622 ft26">If the Lender delivers such notice of illegality, the Facility will be cancelled three (3) Business Days following the date of delivery of the notice to the Borrower. If the Lender certifies that, because of a legal requirement, a change of the applicable laws or regulations, or the interpretation of these rules or because of a new decision made by any relevant authority, applicable to the Lender, any Advance must be repaid before the relevant Advance Repayment Date, the Borrower agrees to repay it on the date specified by the Lender, which shall not be earlier than fifteen (15) Business Days from the date of such notice, together with the accrued interest and fees due hereunder until the actual repayment date.</P>
<P class="p1623 ft159">VI. Reporting</P>
<P class="p1621 ft23">The Lender shall provide quarterly statements of the outstanding balance and accrued interest under the Facility and the final maturity dates, within fifteen (15) Business Days after the end of each quarter.</P>

forslag.lydelse: Riksdagen antar regeringens förslag till lag om omställningsstöd (avsnitt 2.1 och 4-10).
Riksdagen antar regeringens förslag till lag om ändring i lagen (1997:1024) om Skatteverkets brottsbekämpande verksamhet (avsnitt 2.2 och 7.8).
Riksdagen antar regeringens förslag till lag om ändring i lagen (2001:181) om behandling av uppgifter i Skatteverkets beskattningsverksamhet (avsnitt 2.3 och 7.9).
Riksdagen antar regeringens förslag till lag om ändring i lagen (2020:435) om ändring i lagen (2001:181) om behandling av uppgifter i Skatteverkets beskattningsverksamhet (avsnitt 2.4 och 7.9).

Riksdagen godkänner avtalet med Europeiska kommissionen om en garanti för ett europeiskt instrument för tillfälligt stöd för att minska risken för arbetslöshet i en krissituation till följd av utbrottet av covid- 19 (SURE) (avsnitt 11.1).
Riksdagen bemyndigar regeringen att under 2020 ställa ut en statlig garanti till Europeiska unionen för SURE som uppgår till högst 848 537 250 euro (avsnitt 11.1).

Riksdagen godkänner deltagaravtalet med Europeiska investeringsbanken samt garantiavtalet med Europeiska investeringsbanken och deltagande länder om en garantifond för stöd till i första hand företag i ekonomiska svårigheter orsakade av utbrottet av covid-19 (avsnitt 11.1).

Riksdagen bemyndigar regeringen att under 2020 ställa ut en statlig garanti till Europeiska investeringsbankens garantifond för stöd till i första hand företag i ekonomiska svårigheter orsakade av utbrottet av covid-19 som uppgår till högst 863 337 362 euro (avsnitt 11.1).
Riksdagen godkänner den föreslagna användningen av anslaget 1:14 Vissa garanti- och medlemsavgifter inom utgiftsområde 2 Samhällsekonomi och finansförvaltning (avsnitt 11.1).
Riksdagen godkänner ändrade ramar för utgiftsområden och anvisar ändrade och nya anslag enligt tabell 1.1.
